description:
MMM. I'm not a big fan of sandos but I do enjoy a fresh one made with lots of love from time to time ;). And when I do order sandwiches for the office, I choose Mission Picnic! The veggies are SOOO FRESHHHHHH. Crunchy arugula.. crunchy romaine.. fresh errthang.

Ordering is  easy - I always order via ChowNow. Love how the sandos arrive- in a box, all cut in half. Perfect for offices and on the go events (like picnics!). Also the perfect half sandwich size so you can eat another half (of a different sando!).  I REALLY enjoyed the deviled egg sando. The brioche bread was delicious. Everyone at the office enjoyed their sando + salad!

Sterling, the owner of Mission Picnic kindly delivered our order this morning. Delivery was flawless and on time (in fact a few minutes early) which fit perfectly with my schedule. 

Here's what I ordered (delivered today 5/23)

Devil's Egg
market egg salad, bacon crumbles, melted provolone, kosher pickles, green leaf lettuce, chives on brioche

Mozzapesto
whole mozzarella, thick tomato, roasted red pepper, baby arugula, balsamic reduction, house made pesto aioli on focaccia

Pollopesto
house made chicken pesto, crumbled goat cheese, thick tomato, baby arugula tossed with lemon chive oil on focaccia

ABT
double bacon, avocado, thick tomato, green leaf lettuce, mayo on focaccia

(not pictured): Deluxe Cobb Salad: chopped romaine, mixed greens, grilled chicken, market egg, crispy bacon, avocado, blue cheese, cherry tomatoes with picnic vinaigrette

Thanks, Mission Picnic!
author: Chantel Y.

description:
If you are in need of eating a salad in a closet, here's the next best option as this is a tiny space on 22nd near Valencia with just three little tables. Luckily I was here after the lunch rush though frankly it wouldn't take much to produce a rush, like two people who want a salad at the same time. There are plenty to choose from, five entree-size ones and two sides. Sandwiches as well, over a dozen listed on the chalkboard. Presumably most people must order to-go...

But hell, I came to eat there. Waitress? Waitress?? Oh, OK, I have to order at their tiny counter. I went for the $10.95 Beets and Greens which came in a box anyway, but it was a big box chock full of goodness - roasted beets, pear slices, berries, fennel, quinoa, goat cheese, toasted pecans, all of it on a bed of mixed greens and drizzled with a balsamic vinaigrette. It was all so neatly organized that it looked like a bento box (photo: http://bit.ly/2HxPrTD). Delicious and plenty left for later.

FOOD - 4 stars...really robust salad enough for another meal
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...did I mention it's a tiny space?
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...cordial
TOTAL - 4 stars...when you know you should have a salad
author: Ed U.

description:
Of all the "standard" type Salads the Cobb salad is typically my favorite. 

Mission Picnic serves up a mean/tasty "Deluxe Cobb". 
Deluxe Cobb $12.50- Chopped romaine, mixed greens, grilled chicken, market egg , crispy bacon, avocado, blue cheese, cherry tomatoes with picnic vinaigrette. 

Very hearty and you can order online ahead of time for pickup. I enjoy my salad and would return for a hearty/healthy meal. 

I like Healthy Foods...occasionally ...lol. For the past year or so I workout multiple times everyday so I typically try to eat at least one Salad a day. Often times I bring my own salad for lunch but sometimes I venture out in the city for some healthy greens.  
When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the Chicken and Waffle Establishment in the SF Bay Area. They are all pretty good this is just my take. 

Rod's San Francisco Salad Rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). I have rankings various foods like Boba, Ramen, Steakhouse, Chicken and Wafffles(random right?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places 
Ranked from Fave to least fave (Business owners don't hate me, all these places are good) 

1 Café du Soleil-Nicoise Salad
2 SweetGreen-Pesto Chicken
3 Darwin Café-Baby Spinach 
4 La Fromagerie-La Mancha Salad
5 Mission Picnic -Deluxe Cobb
6 Mixt-Mixt Cobb
7 Plutos-Custom salad
8 La Capra-The Cobb
9 Tender Greens-Chinese Chicken
10 Soma Eats-Spinach, Date and Goat Cheese Salad
11 Blue Barn Gourmet-Cobber (Cobb Salad)
12 Split Pea Seduction-The Squash salad
13 Boxed Foods-Boxed Chicken Salad
14 Kitava-Pesto Chicken Cobb
15 Native Co-Native Salad
16 Soma Chicken-Caesar Salad
17 Proper Food-Lemon Quinoa Salad with Chicken
18 Eatsa-Various Salads/bowls 
19 The New Spot on Polk-Asian Chicken
20 Organic Coup-Kale/Caesar Combo 
21 Uno Dos Tacos-Fish Salad Bowl
author: Rod M.

description: Best Sandwiches in San Francisco!  While you won't see it if you blink as you walk by they are on Caviar and worth every penny.  The sandwiches are beautifully crafted, unique and tasty and the salads can actually feed two.  I've ordered multiple times and have fallen in love with the Egg Salad (what is that crazy spice in there?) on lettuce.  Run, don't walk!
author: Cindy S.

description:
I love this place. It's a popular and well known spot but is small and has a hole in the wall type feeling to it. They specialize in sandwiches and salads that are uh-maze-ing. I've been here several times and have always ordered the deluxe cobb salad because it's just that good. It's your typical cobb salad and includes the fixings such as grilled chicken breast, hard boiled eggs, avocado, bacon, tomatoes, romaine lettuce and blue cheese. It's so simple yet so good!

I love that the ingredients they use are always fresh! The romaine lettuce have a nice crisp to them and the tomatoes have a little snap to them and they're sweet. The rest of the ingredients look just as fresh and taste like they were straight from the farm or bought that morning. On top of the freshness, you get a big serving for a great price! A bang for your buck spot is hard to find, especially a place that uses fresh and high quality ingredients. You'll spend anywhere between 9-13$ for a meal. Mission Picnic is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.

The only thing I would like for them to change is to add a little more vinaigrette.
author: Steve H.

description:
We were about 10 minutes away from Mission Picnic when I realized I could save time by ordering ahead. I created a Caviar account, made an order, and it was ready for pick up by the time we got there! (~12:30pm on a Saturday.) This was an easy, quick, and seamless experience.

Oh and of course, their sandwiches are always amazing. 

* Pollo Pesto ($9.95) - 4.5 stars
Soft, moist chicken chunks. Flavorful pesto. Crunchy bread. And still warm by the time we walked to Dolores. Can't ask for much more!

* San Franciscan ($9.50) - 4 stars
Much more savory sandwich, perfect for my bf!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Came here off a recommendation from my friend who was staying at my place. Cool little shop set up in the mission. A lot of different sandwich choices, and you can order ahead to be able to pick up (I believe). 

I got the salmon sandwich as a nice treat to myself because I was feeling a little too sick to want to cook. It was made in under 10 minutes I believe, and I was able to grab a table to sit and wait for my food. They package the sandwich nicely in case you wanted it to go, but it was nice outside so I stayed. Will be coming back here when possible.
author: Rajeev S.

description: No complaints. One of my go to spots. So far everything I ordered has been great! Sorry for the boring review.
author: H K.

description:
THE. BEST. SANDWICH. IN. THE. WORLD. aka the Pollopesto. Ooooommmg. I never had a sandwich where i enjoyed every single bite. 5/5 seriously.

Premium vegan- felt like a health god eating this sandwich. Taste was a 3/5 but for a healthier choice- worth it. To help the slight blandness- i got the mamazuma revenge chips which were bomb if you enjoy spicy food! 

The bread is insanely good. Its crispy on the outside, but soft and chewy in the inside. The chicken was super moist- and the pesto was perfect in seasoning. This place was so good that i woke up the next day and walked 10 blocks to have it again. Need i say more?????
author: Jen Y.

description:
This little gem is incredible! My fiancé and myself have tried this place a couple times, and each time has been amazing. They deliver really fast, too! (with our orders being correct, naturally) 

I personally am not normally one for sandwiches, but Mission Picnic has made me a believer! If all places made sandwiches as delicious as theirs, I wouldn't mind having sandwiches more regularly. They've set the bar really high with a brand new standard for sandwiches!! 

My favorite sandwich from here is the smoked salmon, and they are pretty darn generous with the salmon which is always a big plus with me :) And the london broil and premium vegan are both tied at a close second (really depends if I'm craving more red meat or something lighter and filled with veggies but still filling).

Their salads are really good as well. I'm particularly fond of their beets and greens entree salad, but their side baby arugula salad was quite filling, too. 

So overall, this place is amazing. They've found new regulars.
author: Aiko H.

description:
This is a small sandwich/salad shop tucked in between two larger shops. And when I say small I mean narrow. There was only room for about three two top tables, pushed up against the right wall. Really a to-go place only. 

I ordered a Rodeo salad. It took about ten minutes for our order to be ready. This salad was similar to most southwestern style salads with a Tex Mex type flair. It had chopped romaine, roast beef, cotija cheese, avocado, corn, black beans, jalapeno, red pepper, red onion, tomato, cilantro, blue corn tortilla chips with chipotle ranch dressing. I got it mainly for the chipotle ranch and avocado. I loved the taste!

It cost $12 and could probably feed at least three people. I'm telling you, this salad weighed five pounds. I took some lettuce out of the salad and saved it before I ate it. Just because it was so gigantic. But, if too much food is my only problem, then I'm ok with that!
author: Hannah G.

description:
For our weekly office lunch, I picked Mission Picnic. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, June 23rd around 12 noon.

*Flatiron: Hot romanian pastrami layered high with melted muenster cheese, kosher pickles, deli mustard on french ($11.95)
*Baby Arugula Side Salad: Baby arugula salad dressed with lemon chive dressing ($3.75)
*Potato Chips: Artisan chips from Route 11, Mama Zuma's Revenge ($1.95)

We have $20 to play with, so yes, I got a sandwich, salad, AND chips! The sandwich melded into one great bite. The pastrami salty, the cheese melty, the pickles sour. I'm not a huge bread person, but it was nice and chewy and soft. I had one bite with the bread and then just ate the insides. The cheese melted onto the bread, so I ended up having a little more bread with the filling which I didn't mind. (You can also request a lettuce wrap if you'd rather avoid the bread that way.) The salad was huge! Very densely packed in the takeout container. It ate some with my sandwich and ended up making a makeshift pastrami arugula salad. The only critique I had of the salad is that it needed more dressing. There was a tiny container about two thirds full for all that salad. It wasn't enough. I adored the chips. Great spice. If you can't handle heat, I suggest you pass on these as they may be the spiciest chips I've ever had.

Great place for sandwiches. All this food actually fed me three times that day. If Mission Picnic comes back into the rotation, I would definitely order from them again.
author: Elena N.

description: Great selection of artisanal sandwiches with super fresh ingredients and homemade bread (try the focaccia...damn!).  I had the Southerner, which comes with bacon, marinated pork, and pimento cheese.  Delicious!  The fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie was a perfect finish.  Friendly service, reasonable prices.  Can't wait to try every sandwich on the menu!
author: Dave N.

description: Great spot for a quick bite. Stopped there for lunch on a weekend and was happy to see the line wasn't out the door and it moved pretty quickly. The bread was fresh and tasty, and the sandwich combinations are top notch. I ordered the pesto, mozzarella and tomato sandwich- so tasty! The bench out front is handy if you have a pup with you (as I did) or if you just want to eat outside. Highly recommend this spot if you're hungry in the Mission!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I pretty simple and generic sandwich. I was expecting better. Limited menu too.

Limited seating.
author: Captain B.

description: Sandwiches to love for. Best pastrami sandwich ever. In the Mission they also do catering.
author: Mychelle T.

description: Had the turkey cranberry sandwich when the office had catering from here. It was delicious! The bread wasn't too hard, the sandwich was moist, and it had sprouts (which I love, and most places don't have it!). All the ingredients had the perfect ratio.  Can't wait to try them again!
author: Chanel H.

description:
Their breakfast catering is delish!  Garlicky herb cream cheese spread and a less guilty sundried tomato & chive spread.  Alongside with some crispy but not too greasy bacon strips and sweet fruit.  Another time they've catered for our office they served smoked salmon for the bagels.  The smoked salmon was so fresh and just the right amount of smokiness especially for an early morning breakfast.  I just wish there were a little more assortment of bagels aside from just plain and poppyseed.  Looks like in their storefront they only serve sandwiches and open for lunch.  So convince your Office Manager to wake you up with a wonderful breakfast catering order from Mission Picnic!  

I hope we can try their sandwiches for lunch catering next!
author: Cat C.

description: I've had lunch from Mission Picnic more than a dozen times. The sandwiches and salads are always delicious and the service is fast and courteous. I especially live their egg salad sandwich, the pastrami sandwich, and their potato salad.
author: Linda R.

description:
It saddens me that this little shop is not somewhere in the East Bay. I'd go here every lunch time just to get a taste of their Rodeo Salad.

Have you ever ordered a salad and thought it was going to be the best meal of the day? Well, I didn't, I thought, ehh I'm here for work and I'm hungry and I saw this little corner store and was like ok sure why not...boy did it blow my mind. I loved how they added chips to it. The meat oh damn the meat it was heavenly. I always toss my salad but the presentation was so well put I almost felt I was being rude mixing it all up. But that's the best part and that's when it tastes so damn good. 

The place inside is cramped and is basically an order and go type of place. Luckily, since I had no place to really go, there was a seat available for me to enjoy this heavenly meal.
author: Ladonna A.

description:
Simple, but delicious. Basically everything a sandwich shop should be.  

I had the pollopesto and it was awesome.
author: Vincent A.

description: Super yum sammies but they ran out of bread while we were here... so make sure you go earlier than later!
author: Michelle C.

description: So at a hiring fair then after wanted to eat. One of my coworkers started to search for a place to eat near by for us due to parking being so difficult & we ordered our sandwiches I got the vegan one and can I say FABOLOUS !!!! Great service ordered via phone was ready even though it was lunch time.... Great taste great price and friendly young man at cash register !!! Oh yeah the bread out of this world.
author: Virginia S.

description: Imagine my excitement when I saw not only a delicious-sounding smoked salmon (my favorite!) sandwich on the menu but also the pictures showing the type of protein portion I would expect for a $13 sandwich (with sales tax for some reason on a cold to-go order at a place clearly designed mainly for to-go orders). Imagine my disappointment when I got home and unveiled what is shown in the picture. There was less than half of the salmon I saw in other pictures on the site, three anemic strands of red onion (yes, I counted), three capers (yes, I counted), and a whisper of cream cheese. If the sandwich looks inflated, its because of the avocado I added at home to make it more filling. Nothing like what was described/shown in the other reviews. Maybe I came on a bad day or maybe they have scaled down their offerings. They also have one of those terminals for cards that prompt you to tip 15% for counter service. The food was OK but for the price not worth it.
author: Chris H.

description: My friends and I ordered to go so we could eat our sandwiches at Dolores park! The service was so quick and it was so easy to pick up. I got the flat iron and it was so tasty!!! I would 100% go back here again.
author: Monica B.

description: By far my favorite sandwich place I have found in San Francisco. Their veggie sandwich is my fav. I definitely look forward to trying other ones
author: Danielle D.

description:
I live right around the corner from this place, so from time to time I'll stop in to give it a second chance. The sandwiches are fine. The problem with this place is that it's essentially a hub for Postmates and other delivery services.

Here's my most recent experience. I walk in and can see one or two people also waiting for their order. I order a sandwich, and my receipt says #11. Right after this, #8 is called out. Great -- that means there's just two more people ahead of me. Then for over twenty minutes not a single order is called out, as they fill a huge Postmates order with what must be at least fifteen sandwiches and salads. Meanwhile other patrons have come in and have ordered, and the place gets packed as they work on the Postmates order, leaving everyone who is actually present waiting. Since it's getting backed up, the guy working the front counter goes back to help them fill the orders, and doesn't put on gloves or have a hair net, in clear violation of the health code.

At really off-peak times you might be able to get your order quickly, but otherwise I'd absolutely stay away. For the amount of time you wait here you could get a much better sandwich at Rhea's, just three blocks away.
author: Evan K.

description: I was drawn to mission picnic by the pictures on yelp and the devils egg sandwich did not disappoint. Can wait to try their other sandwiches
author: John H.

description: ABT is awesome and what I typically order. The Focaccia bread is divine. Today I tried the Picnic Club and it was really great as well. Truly an awesome place to grab a quick bite. You won't be sorry. They have limited seating so be prepared to have to grab and go if there are not any seats available. I hope to try a salad next time but man it's hard to pass up a sandwich.
author: Autumn C.

description: I am writing this review mainly based on the service that I received.  I came here on a Saturday, a Sunday, and a weekday.  I tried the smoked salmon the first time and the chicken salad sandwich the second time.  I also ordered their lemonade, which was very sour.  Really sour.  Like the sour candy/lemon juice with a bit of sugar type of sour.  The sandwiches overall were good, the portion sizes were great, neatly wrapped, and didn't fall apart when I ate them.  But the service is another story.  Even though I came here on three days, I didn't try any of the sandwiches on the weekday that I came here because I walked in and heard the staff member tell the lady in front of me that they ran out of bread.  It's a sandwich shop and they ran out of bread.  So I only ordered the lemonade.  When I was here on the Saturday and Sunday I was able to order from the sandwich menu but the service wasn't great.  When I would ask questions the manager/staff member seemed very impatient with me, even though it wasn't a busy time of day.  He was very vague with answering my questions and seemed a little uptight/annoyed.  Like sheesh, it's not like I'm playing 20 questions or giving him a quiz.  What's the point of working in the service industry if you can't stand simple conversations?  With my experience in the service industry I know customers can be difficult sometimes but in this case he was very unprofessional and I never went back because I was too intimidated.
author: Lola S.

description: I was wowed by their sandwiches   It was fresh, with great ingredients. Perfect amount of ingredients into a sandwich. No complaints here! Definitely fan!
author: Meishi M.

description: I'm not sure why this place receives a four star review?  I was supper excited to try this place for a while and the sandwich I got was pretty disappointing.  It was all bread and very little meat and vegetables.  I would expect more for $10.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
Came here on a whim while hungry in the mission and it was so awesome. I do not typically pay for sandwiches or seek them out when I'm out, but damn, I'd come back here in a second. 
I got a picnic club with added avocado and it was one of the most delicious treats I've ever had. 
People came spilling in with orders right after us and they were taking phone orders too, so the wait was a little ridiculous for 3 sandwiches. There's not a lot of space inside but they do have a bathroom and water, so there's a plus. 
Would definitely come back!!
author: Amy R.

description: Two sandos and a big salad, all fantastically good, for $30. Quick to order and pickup, using Caviar to advance order at no charge. Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!
author: Holly H.

description:
You will adore the sandwiches here, and the salads, and the watermelon juice. Small place with only a couple tables for two, and no wifi, so it's mostly a takeout adventure. 

My sandwich was so great I had a dream that night about eating it again. It's that kind of sandwich. High quality ingredients, and if you are a vegan like I am, you will go bananas for the flavor. 

Total hole in the wall, totally worth it in every way.
author: Kate B.

description: The mission club is sadly not a double decker sandwich as most clubs are, but instead comes on ciabatta. But it's an excellent piece of ciabatta that more than makes up for the joy lost in having a novelty middle piece of bread. It's a pretty tasty sandwich, even in a neighborhood and city full of tasty sandwiches and I think the next time I go, I'll try the pollo pesto.
author: Misha T.

description:
Mission Picnic got me to eat a Vegan Sandwich.

AND I LIKED IT.

http://goo.gl/eP7GVe

The veggies were fresh, the focaccia was toasty and the hummus, tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, sprouts and avocado were expertly stacked.  

If I was a nitpicky vegan, I'd suggest adding garlic to the hummus and then more hummus.

BUT I'M NOT.

Looking forward to my next Mission Picnic @ Mission Picnic!
author: Amy C.

description: LOVE this place near our church! New favorites- but pricey but worth every dollar. Fresh, huge portions and unique! Husband ordered the Southerner and Loved it - he is Fan of pimento cheese and a southerner. I ordered the smoked salmon sandwich - delicious and perfect. Saved the other half for lunch next day. We shared the beet salad and it was fantastic! Tried the hot jalapeño chips and they are HOT!
author: June R.

description:
Even though we came to Mission Picnic for their Hainan Chicken sandwich (which they did not have), my experience here turned out to be positive.

Yes, the place is pretty small, but the line (which can grow to be quite long) does go by quickly. They have a number of great selections here, so know what you're getting because it's easy to change your mind!

Since I smelled the bacon wafting in from the kitchen, I knew I had to get a sandwich with bacon... so naturally, I went with the ABT which has, yes, DOUBLE BACON. I also decided to get a side of potato salad since I love potato salad (and I was wanted to eat a little something while waiting for my bacon-licious sandwich).

We decided to eat at Dolores Park, so after a pleasant walk from the sandwich shop to the park, I FINALLY got to unwrap my sandwich.

Before I started eating, I had to admire my ABT first. Mission Picnic did NOT hold back on the bacon. The proportion of all the ingredients was beautiful. Then I had to eat it... and oh my goodness was it such an out of body experience. 

That bacon... THAT BACON. WAS INCREDIBLE. SO CRISPY AND DELICIOUS AND SO MUCH OF IT. Not to mention, the mayo was KILLER and the avocado was SO FRESH. The ABT was DEFINITELY the best BLT-type sandwich I have ever had in my life thus far. I can't forget about the bread either... so amazing.

Why four stars? The sandwich was DEFINITELY five stars. Unfortunately, the potato salad was a little too rich for my liking. A little too much cheese... though the first few bites were pretty good.

If you're ever looking for a place to get your picnic fixings, definitely stop by Mission Picnic!
author: Sara C.

description: My co workers and I Work in The neighborhood. We always order for pick up... Every time we ordered never a disappointment. The ingredients are extremely fresh and their staff is very friendly. Looking forward to working, wish there was a neighborhood discount! Lol
author: Sasha M.

description: I'm always excited when my girlfriend comes home with a bag from Mission Picnic. I can't comment on the restaurant itself, but I can comment on the food. The sandwiches are always packed with the fixings, and the meat is always fresh. The sandwiches are big enough for nearly two meals, and I'm a big guy. The downside with this place would have to be the hours, very limited if work during most of the afternoon. Still good sandwiches.
author: Joel G.

description:
It's like hole in the wall. If you're not from around here you might just miss the place. It's grab and go cuz there were only 3 tables available. Was glad there were no line and the manager was super helpful. 
Didn't know what to get. I wanted the nervo Cubano but he said no longer in the menu for sometime. So I must have read some very old reviews. 
So manager saw that I was unsure, he promptly suggested some of their popular sandwiches.
Decided on the San Francisco with added spice. It is good. 
The bread was crunchy yet soft. The meat moist with fresh vegetables. 
I am happy. I will return. 
Great personal service by the manager/owner.
author: Nelle L.

description: This is definitely my favorite place to get a vegan sandwich from, the premium vegan sandwich is sooooo good like omg you have to try it!!! Love it lots. Customer service is great too, they're really fast and nice. 10/10 would recommend
author: Alisha A.

description: Where I can get my egg salad fix. ProTip: they sometimes close a little before stated closing time so don't dillydally on your way over.
author: Yes P.

description:
My favorite to go place for sandwiches and salads.  Everyone is extremely nice.  They also cater to companies throughout San Francisco.  My favorite us the Salumi special.  
It's located in the heart of mission with lots of walk in traffic.  Long lines during the lunch rush!
author: Sheila P.

description:
Pricey but legit sandwiches! 
Small "dining area"
Very  mission hipster.
They have a set menu & multiple sandwiches that change all the time.
The reason for my 4 stars is that a girl working told is how sick she was then proceeded to  & help w/ our sandwiches... Ewwww
author: Ashley G.

description:
Sandwiches:
CRANTURKEY - YESSS! Cranberry sauce in a sandwich was something I never tried before and it is amazing! Turkey is nice and moist and NOT DRY! Cause dry turkey is the worst. The sprouts gave it nice little crunch and was a good pairing with the rest of the sandwich as it complemented well.

POLLOPESTO- Also amazing! I love pesto on just about anything so I had to get this sandwich. It was absolutely amazing and I love the satisfying crunch sound I get when I bite into it. 

SMOKED SALMON- Got it once and it's great too. I love smoked salmon and cream cheese so this was my kind of sandwich. But since it's more expensive, I only got it once. 

Salads:
I think I tried almost all of the salads except for the Winter Wedge.

DELUXE COBB - As good as a Cobb can get. Sometimes I am fond of the bleu cheese, sometimes I am not. Chicken is really fresh and big pieces. They don't skimp on that! 

BEETS AND GREENS - I got this once by accident and I was pleasantly surprised by how good beets were. I don't think I ever had beets prior to this salad. I also enjoyed the candied pecans since it was a nice flavor to go along with the salad. I wish they had pecans in the other salads!

CHOPPED ITALIAN - It was good but not my favorite since I like avocados and eggs in my salads usually. I'm much of a Cobb kind of girl.

KALE CAESAR - There is this one single anchovy piece that stares back at me when I open my box. The smell always hits me but I am not an anchovy-hater although sometimes I don't know if having it adds to the salad. Get this with chicken because I do not know how people can eat just kale by itself. I just wish the kale was more chopped up instead of in a giant leaf form.

All the vinaigrettes are good. Red wine vinaigrette is my favorite. I do not like the caesar dressing as much since I prefer a creamier dressing and their caesar is bit thicker and mayo-like. But all their salads are great portions and super filling. They give you good size everything so a whole egg, nice cherry tomatoes and avocado, fresh lettuce, fresh chicken cut up in nice pieces and all. 

Awesome place! They deliver to anywhere in SF for $5 flat. They're always quite timely with my order deliveries. I did have two times when I was missing an order or got the wrong item but it was quick to reach them by phone to get that fixed. I can't even be mad since their food is so good and they're also really nice on the phone and even gave me an apology cookie+chips once. I gave the cookie to my co-worker but it smelled really good. SO GOOD. 

Oh, and sometimes you get the person with the really beautiful handwriting who draws smiley faces on your boxes. Like who doesn't want to unravel a sandwich that has your name and a smiley face written on it?
author: Diana C.

description: Wonderful sandwiches! We spent the day browsing this neighborhood and we're lucky enough to find this place when we got hungry. Super quality Ingredients with fair prices.
author: A B.

description: New favorite sandwich spot in the city. Split the Southerner and Flat Iron with my boyfriend and didn't stop talking about how delicious the sandwiches were for like an hour after eating.
author: Jessica K.

description: My office decided to get some sandwiches to have for lunch for a co-worker's BD. We placed the order a day ahead. Sandwiches were done on time and it was ready for pickup when I arrived. All my co-workers loved their sandwiches. I ordered the Pollo Pesto and it was soooo delicious. I am definitely gonna try this place out again in the near future.
author: Ernesto I.

description: Just back from Australia, jet lagged so hard I can barely pull myself off the couch. I missed my Cobb salad from Mission Picnic the most, so I hop online to check the hours, Google says 6pm, score! I get there at 4pm and they are clearly closing up, they could have easily turned me away and I wouldn't have been mad about it, but instead, on Sunday, pride weekend when they could have just locked up and gone and shaken their drunk ass booties with everyone else, they take me as the last order (and I didn't even mention that google said they were open later). Not only that, but it was probably the BEST Cobb I've had. They put a lot of love into that last minute salad. Huge props to the closing crew on 6/25/2017. Left a big tip but you deserve to know that you are rockstars via words as well. Thank you for sedating this jet lagged lunatic.
author: Tom K.

description:
SOOO many delicious sandwiches and salads created with high quality ingredients. Choosing will be hard, but you'll find solace in the fact that you can return next time and try another delicious sandwich or salad (but let's be real - probably a sandwich). The watermelon juice is super tasty and refreshing. 

I can't wait to try the entire menu!
author: Sara M.

description: Great portions, fresh ingredients, wish you were open for dinner! Perfect for healthy takeout
author: Haley Y.

description:
Really great food, SUPER EXPENSIVE though.
The sandwiches are super delicious though, and the kale caesar is flavorful and outstanding. 
But really a sandwich and salad shouldn't come out to almost 30 bucks. Work with us here :)
author: Lauren V.

description: Great hole in the wall sandwich spot with really fair prices and tasty flavors. The wait is usually 10-15 mins as they fulfill a lot of catering orders. Best to call in to make an order if you don't have time to wait. Cool people working there
author: Rachel T.

description:
Stopped by for lunch! Cute little sandwich shop with nice service! 

I ordered the MozzaPesto Sandwich & Watermelon Juice. I enjoyed the Watermelon Juice more than the sandwich! I think the roasted red pepper in the MozzaPesto threw me off. The Watermelon Juice reminded me of the Watermelon Juice I drank when I was in Krabbi, Thailand, sooo good!!!!!!!

I will come back to try the Cesar Salad & a few other sandwiches, then update my review!
author: Geraldine R.

description: Simple menu Good sandwiches. This place doesn't try to be too much. I like to call in my orders because it can get busy during lunch time and the place is super small. Best for take away there are only three tables in the place. Watermelon juice is good too!
author: Thatcher H.

description: Great great customer service, delicious sandwiches and salads.  They delivered our large catered order on time and correct, could not be happier with them and will use them again.  Thank you
author: Noyan A.

description:
Blink and you'll miss this tiny spot on 22nd but I hope that you don't as it's excellent.  I ordered the Nuevo Cubano and it was delicious.  The pineapple and avocado jalapeno aioli really made the sandwich.  I also got the watermelon juice which was quite refreshing.

If you're a sandwich fan (and how could you not), check out Mission Picnic and you won't be disappointed.
author: Blake B.

description:
Hubs and I split a Devil's Eggs sandwich and a Deluxe Cobb salad. Initially thought the price for the sandwich was steep but it was pretty large and was the perfect size for splitting. 

The salad was also largely portioned. I was pleased to see we got our money's worth of avocado, bacon or chicken as they certainly did not skimp on these ingredients.
author: Esther A.

description:
I am writing this review without even having tried the food from this establishment and it is purely based on the customer service I received from a man who identified himself as the owner. 

I would absolutely caution you not to use this place for catering a large group. Walk-in and pick ups only since you won't be in a rush and it's more of a situation that you as a customer can control. 

7 days ago (2/4) I placed on order online for a picnic platter to feed 40 people with desserts and drinks. It was scheduled to be delivered today (2/11) at 11:30am and I have a confirmation email outlining this. At 11:45am when it hadn't shown up I called to get an ETA. 

From the jump it was clear that for whatever reason dude was not familiar with our order. He ultimately ended up saying there was a 'glitch' in the computer and we were scheduled for tomorrow - I don't buy it, I believe we were overlooked and someone forgot to put us in the lineup for today's deliveries and he was covering. 

Why this person is on the phone dealing with customers is beyond me. It might benefit him to hire someone with customer service experience in the food industry if frustrations overwhelm him to the point of being so rude. 

I started our conversation very politely, introduced myself, gave context as to what I was calling in reference to, offered my order number, and everything was bumbled. 
"Who are you? What's your name? Your calling from what company? Do you have your order number?", and as I was trying to answer his questions I was being interrupted as if I was inconveniencing him. I finally had to tell him to stop speaking over me so I that I could give him the information he was asking for.  When I wasn't being interrupted I was being talked over with really annoyed, exasperated sighs "Ugh, oh my goooodd. Ugh, geeez.". 

When we finally got to a resolution I was offered all of the food I originally ordered, albeit an hour late or a refund. I told dude I wanted both and he laughed saying "You want the food for free?" - uhm, actually I want the service I paid for but since we are well beyond that being a possibility I want a refund and delivery of the items you promised. 

When our order arrived the driver told me that they never charged our card because the system never sent our order to him so when I informed him that what he was telling me was the exact opposite of what the owner told me (and the exact opposite of what the order confirmation and refund confirmation emails told me) all he could do was stare blankly.

As a small business owner I'd think he would have jumped at the opportunity to rectify the issue and retain customer who places orders for more than $600 a pop but it seems as if that's no important to him.

Give your patronage to this establishment at your own risk.
author: McKenna B.

description:
One of my favorite FOBanese dishes is Hainan Chicken Rice. Something about the simply boiled chicken, deliciously oily rice and aromatic ménage a trios of sauces (chili, ginger and dark soy) makes me...uhh, makes me happy. Sorry, going to keep it PG-rated for once.

So naturally seeing the Hainan Chicken Sandwich on Mission Picnic's FB page almost made me keel over. A FOBanese American Sandwich? I'm all over it! I hoped into my imaginary rice rocket and vroomed vroomed my way to Mission Picnic yesterday while bumping to Stevie B.

Mission Picnic is a new sandwich shop serving seasonal sandwiches; some with an Asian twist. They're currently in their soft opening stage and have an awesome deal of 50% off your purchase (till today). Their Grand Opening is tomorrow.

Formerly the Corazon Juice Bar, Mission Picnic is a tiny shop with just four two-top tables so this is more of a to-go place.

For their soft opening, they had 6 sandwiches available (~$8-9):
*Picnic Club (Rotisserie chicken salad w/ bacon & cheddar)
*Hainan Chicken (Garlic rotisserie chicken w/ cucumber & picnic spread)
*San Franciscan (Hot pastrami, turkey & provolone)
*Devil's Egg (Market boiled egg, bacon & provolone)
*MozzaPesto (Mozzarella, basil, tomato & pesto aioli)
*The King (Peanut butter, bananas, honey chocolate & frosted flakes).

They'll also have soups and salads in the future. 

Make sure to try one of their refreshing fruit shakes (pineapple, watermelon or strawberry - $2.75). I had the watermelon which was more like a fresh watermelon juice slushy but it was really good (no sugar added).

CASH ONLY.

The Hainan Chicken Sandwich was nicely packed with tenderly moist garlic rotisserie chicken, sliced cucumbers, tomato, lettuce & picnic spread on dutch crunch: http://bit.ly/171yYMd. The picnic spread of garlic and parsley was slathered onto the bread before toasting so all that garlicky goodness soaked into every nook and cranny. So yummy!

While the sandwich was solid and made with top-notch ingredients, it was more like a garlic pesto-ish chicken sandwich to me. I was hoping it would be more FOBanese. There was no ginger in the spread and ginger is what makes hainan chicken "hainan" imo. And, although the dutch crunch had a deliciously crunchy mottled crust, I think a less carb heavy bread like a baguette would let the ingredients shine for this particular sandwich. Just my two cents.

One of owners, Sterling was super nice and encouraged customer feedback which is always a sign to build customer loyalty and remain competitive in this marketplace. I hope he does see this and offers several FOBanese sandwich options in the future including vegan options for my Yelpie friend John B.  who's always in the hood and for all the surrounding PBR drinking and camel toe inducing skinny jean lovers of course.

Mission Picnic has a lot of potential and this was just their soft opening so I can't wait to see what other specialty sandwich ideas they have up their sleeve...

Perhaps a pulled pork with apple wasabi slaw sandwich, a Tonton sesame marinated tofu w/ portobello mushroom sandwich, a longanisa banh mi or a loco moco sloppy joe? I can go on and on.

Now only if I can come up with ideas like that in my field of work instead of looking like a deer caught in headlights all the time...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Cute shop with some very tasty sandwich options. Sandwiches came out pretty quickly and the service was nice. Not the best place if you have a group of people, as there are only 3 small tables inside. Would definitely a place I'll keep in mind if I'm in the area and craving some fresh savory sandwiches. Would like to try some of their salad options too. 

I got the sanfranciscan and new salmon sandwiches. Both were delicious. The salmon was a good refreshing and filling sandwich. Sanfranciscan was a bit heavier, but just as delicious and filling. Decent portions for a  $9-12 sandwiches.
author: Christy C.

description: Great little lunch spot! The place is long and skinny with 3 tiny tables crammed against the wall. I ordered the smoked salmon sandwich light on the cream cheese w a side of jalapeño chips and fresh watermelon juice. Delicious!!! The bread tasted like a dutch crunch and only towards the end did I realize the sandwich contained pickles which I normally hate but enjoyed unknowingly. Bit on the pricey side but good sized portions and  healthy ingredients. Will be back to try other things on the menu!
author: Yin H.

description: Irritated about today's delivery! I got 2 salads and paid over $30! They barely filled up my box with salad and it's supposed to be a deluxe cobb salad. I always get the same order so I know how much it's filled up and I felt they ripped me off today. $33 on salads - I should be full.
author: Lucky N.

description:
Yummy and delicious. If you are a vegetarian, you have 2 great options! The eggplant sandwich is delicious and the pesto is awesome. 

I had the vegan sandwich and it was also delicious. The focaccia bread was perfect and the sandwich was SUPER filling. Also, the chips are delicous.
author: Akshaya V.

description:
Incredible bread, fresh delicious flavors, unbelievable watermelon juice. This sounds crazy but there's a "swagger" to this sandwich place. I'm very eager to go back.

Pollopesto - 5/5. Pesto very flavorful, lemon chive oil does come through to combine the ingredients.
author: Ojus P.

description:
Amazing salads that are a healthy and fulfilling meal. 

Super high quality ingredients, and generous portions on the salads make it well worth the price.
author: Lydia C.

description:
We ordered from this spot on eat24.

I ordered the Caprese sandwich with arugula.

The sammy was a twist on the Caprese I love madly, but the arugula threw my taste buds off and ruined the bad*** experience I normally have with a Caprese.

The pesto in the sandwich was damn good, the bread and cheese were solid, and the tomato and arugula were fresh. 

Do it, just ask for NO ARUGULA.

That is it. That is all.
author: Gabriela W.

description: This place used to be great but it seems like new operators took over. Now the sandwiches are not as good, and the service is brusque, at best. Will not return.
author: Chou H.

description:
This place used to deliver through eat24 and I LOVED IT. Now, sadly, they don't. Not sure why. I miss it!

Sandwiches are kick ass, esp the chicken salad. Best in town!

Please start delivering again!
author: JJ F.

description: Very tasty sandwiches and friendly waitstaff. I have tried the pollopesto and really liked it. I have tried the San Francisco, which was nice. My wife got the Mozzapesto, which she said was fantastic.
author: Benjamin T.

description: At first I was a little upset I paid $10 for a sandwich ($14 with watermelon juice) but then I started eating it... Would've paid $20 for that pollopesto sandwich it was so dang good. Bread was perfectly crisp and you can tell only fresh ingredients are used. Huge portion, too! This place is a cute hole in the wall, but we warned it only seats about 6 people! I walked over to nearby mission park to eat.
author: Carolyn K.

description: yuk! The Beets where old as heck and the pears weren't ripe, the salad dressing was like pouring on molasses. The nuts were stale and the lettuce limp. Never again!
author: Catherine M.

description:
Great recommendation from the folks down at Chocolatier Blue. Looks like a hole in the wall but loved the relaxed, friendly vibe. Was also in need of a place to charge my phone and appreciated all of the outlets.

I got the CranTurkey Sandwich and it was YUMMY! At first I was a little put off by the thickness of the bread, it looked huge, but then I tasted the bread. So worth the calories! It tasted like a little butter in every bite, which complemented the CranTurkey goodness. Ate the whole thing and had to have a late dinner because of it but was worth it!

Also enjoyed the watermelon juice, which has no sugar or junk added to it. Just sweet, delicious watermelon.   

Would definitely come here again!
author: Julie H.

description:
I'm not a sandwich guy. There's just something about cold cuts and soggy bread that turns me off.

However, Mission Picnic averts both crimes to sandwich-kind in one fell swoop. The pollo pesto sammie I got was surprisingly fresh, without coming off as...premanufactured. The arugula and tomato were real fresh as well. The best part? The bread was firm and fresh too! Hallelujah!

They do charge a lot ($9+ a sammie), but I've seen worse. I'm looking at you Ike's...
author: Casey S.

description: I really enjoyed the Cobb salad from here. At $12, it's certainly not the most economic salad, but you're in for a treat. Mixed greens base with half an avocado, crispy bacon strips, hard boiled egg, juicy grilled chicken, blue cheese crumbles and to top it off, a sweet tangy apple vinaigrette.
author: Alex S.

description:
I first discovered this place about a year ago. I tried a number of their sandwiches, which were great. They have fresh ingredients and tasty sauces/spreads. I had to stop eating them because they were too big and addictive and probably caused some weight gain for me. I started ordering just the salads and only oder a sandwich if someone is willing to share it with me. The kale caesar salad became my favorite. It was a mix of fresh romaine, baby kale, perfectly salted anchovies, great croutons, thick shavings of parmesan, and the best caesar dressing I ever had. The dressing was extra creamy with the perfect anchovy flavoring.

They seem to have raised their prices and changed the ingredients of their kale caesar salad. The salad is more expensive and smaller. They now use the rough curly kale rather than the tender baby kale. The parmesan shavings have been dry and rubbery. My favorite creamy caesar dressing has been replaced with an oily sour dressing. I thought the dressing was a mistake when I first noticed it a couple weeks ago, but I have tried it a few times now and they seemed to have permanently changed it...very disappointing.
author: D. P.

description:
Love love love Mission Picnic.  It's our spot to grab salads and sandwiches before hitting Dolores Park.  I've also had them cater at my office and everyone loved it.  

The owner is super nice and enthusiastic about his food!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Mission (Picnic) Accomplished

This past summer, I interned at a landscape architecture firm smack dab in the middle of the Mission. Known for its eclectic food--from taquerias to dosa places--the Mission is a mecca for unique flavors. However, working at an architecture firm, I often needed quick and easy meals on the go without compromising taste or nutrition. A co-worker suggested that I try Mission Picnic, and oh boy, I was not disappointed. 

My favorite sandwich is the Picnic Club. Layers of tasty goodness: chicken, bacon, lettuce, cheese, pickles, mustard, and mayo. And the bread! No sandwich is complete without a freshly toasted bun. Mission Picnic offers a large selection of speciality sandwiches, unique to the store, of which you just have to try one of each. It also features other picnic items, such as salads, chips, blended juices, and cookies. Sandwich prices are a bit steep (about $9-$10 including tax), but Mission Picnic sandwiches make it up in deliciousness. You definitely aren't going to get a $5 footlong here (and why would you want to?)

The storefront is small with a few tables and chairs, but its presence is very strong. With its hand written menu and funky decor, it's represents the Mission very well.

I was in the Mission today and wanted to visit all the food places I missed while I was away. One of the first to come to mind was Mission Picnic. Per usual, I ordered the Picnic Club and it was as delicious as I remembered. The counter server was Kathleen--one of the sweetest girls you'll ever meet. My sandwich was prepared by Sterling, the owner, a sandwich connoisseur, and, I must say, a little bit of a flirt. Also, shout out to Brian who was counting the till as I was complimenting the staff.

Being back at Mission Picnic reminded me of how small businesses can have a strong impact on a community. A sandwich is just a sandwich until it represents something more. Food is much more than about sustenance; it's about an experience. 

So if you're hankering for a really, really good sandwich in the Mission District, scoot your butt to 22nd Street between Valencia and Mission, grab yourself a sandwich, have a picnic in Dolores Park, and enjoy!
author: Joanna S.

description:
I'm still not sure what the fuss is all about here.  I had a sandwich after a bike ride thru the mission and it really didn't do much to make me want to come back for more.  

The turkey was meh, but then again, what the hell am I doing ordering a turkey sandwich in the first place.  There wasn't much bacon in my sandwich, either that or it was turkey bacon, because I didn't taste the bacon. The spread was unique and I did appreciate the bread being toasted the way it was toasted.  I made a rookie move in not getting the watermelon drink and potato salad.

Ok ok, I will be coming back in the future. No turkey sandwich next time though.
author: Kelvin W.

description:
Though I've never eaten Hainan Chicken at a bonafied Asian joint, Mission Picnic's appropriation of the dish as a sandwich filling hits the spot. It's comforting, especially warm on a crusty French roll. 

Besides the typical sandwich toppings (shredded lettuce, tomato), the subtle-tasting pulled chicken is dressed in scallion oil & garlic butter--those condiments just made the sandwich. 

Only complaint (and this is the neurotic food issues havin' part of me talkin', so feel free to ignore) is aside from breast meat, the not-so-pretty parts like fat, skin, & other general gross chicken parts I like to avoid, were chopped in. Most people don't mind those parts, but it drives me insane. As a whole, sandwich tasted good enough that I didn't mind having to pick out the few offending pieces. 

Place only has two tables, so be prepared to take your sandwich to-go. 

$10 minimum for credit card purchases.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Have tried several different salads and a few sandwiches. Everything is tasty but a bit overpriced, specially for lunch. What happened to a lunch menu or half salad/half sandwich combo?? Love their watermelon juice, Cobb salad ,and their smoked salmon sandwich.
author: Maria R.

description:
High quality ingredients.
Attentive staff and owner.
Strong attention to detail and creativity when it comes to the menu.
Space is clean and comfortable.
author: Alex C.

description:
The Cobb salad is to die for. It's so good that it compelled me to write a Yelp review. I wish I could say I've tried other items here (and I definitely will some day) but I just had to let the word out, for all of my fellow Cobb salad enthusiasts out there. The ingredients are so fresh that it reminds me of a way better version of a salad my mom would make.

The guys who work here are super cute as well. Killer Cobb salads and eye candy workers - be still my heart.
author: Emily T.

description:
I've had this place twice now and the first time was great. I shared an ABT sando and a massive beet and green salad. No complaints that day. Didn't even mind the kind of inflated price.

Second time I go in, I order the kale caesar and the nuevo cubano. NO KALE. I kid you not, this was the worst kale caesar salad I've ever had for $8 +3 with chicken!) in that it didn't have kale in it. Just romaine, those fake, crappy, flavorless croutons, maybe like 4 tiny tomatoes and 3 pieces of tiny anchovies and the dressing was pretty gross. I almost called them because it was such a huge disappointment. When you call something a "kale caesar" it should have more kale and less romaine. Why emphasize the kale part in the title? After the beet and greens salad, I was expecting something higher quality. The cubano was 9.50 and turned to mush. Maybe the other sandos are okay, but that's not one of the better ones. I'm very hesitant to go in again.
author: Tori M.

description:
Mission Picnic has 10ish sammies on it's board, looks like an hole in the wall, doesn't have much seating

menu: sammies, salads, juices, chips

eats:Hainan Chicken 
-"pulled garlic chicken, shredded lettuce, tomato, cucumber, cilantro, garlic butter, oil,
on french rustic bread"
-moist, schredded chicken, very tasty, not 5 stars though.(flavors too subtle)

crumbs:
-is mission picnic better than ike'?, maybe a better value, taste maybe a tie.
-sammies made to order, 5 minutes?
-reuben.also on list.
-cash only
-metered parking nearby or free on side streets.
author: Victor G.

description:
(See pics) Review #1351.Sandwich is more 3.5 stars. The 4 stars is because of the dessert.

What was once popular Corazon Juicebar (there were people coming in looking for the old place) now is a sandwich shop. No sign until Friday (3/28) as they are really trying to test out their menus WITHOUT too much publicity.

I really think the owner has a kick in making DESSERTS more than the sandwiches and that is why reviewing the dessert first as it's the real highlight!

Sterling has recently lived in France so this looks like a dream extension. Every dessert is made by him and as he mentioned (yeah sorry I was skeptical), it's the lighter sweet kind! They looked so very pretty and meticulously elegant, from tiramisu to chocolate, to fruit tarts. All were lovely and I had the strawberry cake and must say the aroma bursts out through the creamy silkness! If they would only add the coffee drink or tea, it will be a perfect afternoon spot or after dinner place to relax.

Onto the sandwiches, they have a handful selection including Devil's Eggs on deli white (suggested it would be a real nice appetizer), Mozzapesto on focaccia, San Franciscon (west coast style pastrami with provolone) on rustic French, The King (only sweet sandwich with peanut butter, banana, honey, chocolate, frosted flakes!) on brioche, Picnic Club (chicken with chipotle) on ciabatta and Hainan Chicken on dutch crunch.

Was totally eying the Hainan chicken but that was the one not recommended. The owner, Sterling, said if you are Chinese and had the Hainan chicken back home, you would find it to be not like that. Asked if maybe there was a twist to his recipe and it was said to still be perfected. So instead I ordered his recommendation (his most confident dish like The Taste show) and had the Picnic Club.

The chicken was decently 3.35 stars but the good substantial size made it up to 3.5 stars. It's $8.5 but paid half price as everything is (drinks and food) until Friday night during their soft opening. The little bacon bites were with a tingle of sweetness and a nice touch of crunchiness. It was also packed with mustard, lettuce and tomato, the standard. Did sincerely suggested that every sandwich has to be good and not just 1 or 2 signatures in the long run and look forward to the future visits.

They also made quiches in house. So many choices in such a small place!

Another major high point is they are currently open until 8pm and midnight on the weekends. This is bound to change to also open until midnight during the week. Considering Revolution is just around the corner and the shop is in between 2 major, major streets of late night establishments, or if you just live in the hood, having a bite here is a refreshing new option comparing with the bacon wrapped hot dogs and pizza, as one patron excitedly pointed out about the choice of switching out pizzas.

The peeps here were super friendly, like Mission genuine friendly, and the business partner who came in a bit later was also a nice chap checking and preparing more decorations and chit chatted with customers.

Do want to see when this tiny shop expands to include next door office space, as well as other choices of sandwiches such as anchovy with capers (would be a definite to try.)

Grand opening is this Saturday and if you are into vodka they are planning on having a party serving that with other refreshments and food.
author: T L.

description: Had the best chicken, pesto and goat cheese sandwich ever. It was really the best sandwich I've had all year. I will be back very soon!
author: Lexi F.

description:
The sandwiches here will put you back almost $9 a pop, but they are very big, so splitting one with a friend is more affordable and ideal :) I don't know why anyone would line up an hour+ for Ike's if they knew Mission Picnic existed: cheaper sandwiches, equally (if not more) delicious, and no line is a triple win in my book! The interior has 3 tables and is super narrow and cute, so taking your sandwich to-go on a sunny SF day makes their "picnic" namesake apt :) 

Hainan Chicken Sandwich was the most unique sandwich on the menu, which stood out to me. The chicken was perfect: not dry at all, and cut into manageable pieces, very true to Hainan style. The rest of the sandwich was perfectly proportioned, the accompanying lettuce was so fresh, and the bread was delectable. highly recommended! Get some napkins, it will be deliciously messy! :)
author: Tuwie N.

description:
5/17/13 Lunch

A new sandwich shop serving sammies with a twist. Upon entering this tiny little shop we were whetted by the menu on the wall: Nuuevo Cubano, Hainan Chicken, ABT, San Franciscan (pastrami and oven-baked turkey)... all sounded good and yummy. After a few minutes of deliberation, my friend and I decided on two to share:

*Nuevo Cubano: roasted pork and black forest ham with red pickled onion, a slice of pineapple on a crispy ciabatta. The avocado/jalapeno aioli and dijon all folded into a yummy flavor. I didn't taste the roasted pork but the ham was good. Pineapple dominated the flavor so maybe they could put more meat?

*Hainan Chicken: this one, served on a rustic French roll, is almost twice the side of the Cubano. "Hainan" is really "Ayam" from Malay, meaning chicken. Ayam became Hainan when the boiled chicken dish came to China. Anyway, the Hainan chicken sandwich here doesn't come with the usual ginger, but a garlicky butter and scallion oil. Maybe they should consider a crushed ginger dip like that you get from a Chinese deli? The chicken is simply boiled but very tender and moist, unlike the usual leathery, rubbery texture of deli chicken. The assembly, complete with cilantro, sliced tomato and cucumber, looked a bit like a bunh mi. 

We were also tempted by their special creation of the day: a French Toast sandwich with lumps of strawberries powdered sugar. But we were too full to have a go at dessert. They also have a PBJ sandwich, as well as a Salami plate. Guilty of having too much carbs? Get the Peach and Avocado salad.

So many possibilities here at Mission Picnic even though they don't offer katsu, the staple of Rhea down the street. They also allowed substitution. A guy came in toward the end of our meal and asked for ABT without the B---that is, bacon! So here you go. Give this place a try. Sammies are not piping toasty.

Minimum $10 for credit card.
author: Matt Y.

description:
I picked up a few sandwiches from here last week to lug to a friend's house for an indoor picnic of sorts. About half an hour later when we finally sat down to eat, I expected the sandwiches to be at least a little soggy and drippy, but that wasn't the case at all-- somehow, after being manhandled for a solid 20 minutes during the walk from Mission Picnic to my friend's place, the sandwiches still managed to stay perfectly intact. The bread was surprisingly still crispy, as if it'd just come out of the oven, and the ingredients were all in their rightful places and tasted totally fresh. The sandwiches weren't dry either, so I have no idea how they maintained their crispiness, but it was gooood. Sandwich magic, I guess.

We shared 4 different sandwiches: the ABT, Pollo Pesto, Nuevo Cubano, and Cranturkey. The Cranturkey was my absolute favorite-- a lightly crisped french roll and just the right amount of cranberry sauce so as to not overpower the rest of the ingredients. The Nuevo Cubano was an unexpected runner up; normally I avoid pineapple in savory dishes because I think the combination is barfworthy, but again, the NC had just enough to add an unexpected kick. I thought the Pollo Pesto tasted a bit bland in comparison to the other sandwiches we picked up, but it actually came out as the favorite for 2 out of 4 people in our sandwich-tasting crew.
author: Kristina C.

description:
Mission Picnic, previously Corazon, opened about 1 week ago serving up sandwiches, salads, and fresh juices. The sandwiches are mostly traditional, with a bit of an interesting flair - the most popular and talked about is the Hainan Chicken sandwich. I wanted to try something different. 

The San Franciscan (~$9.50) was screaming my name, with ingredients like Pastrami, Turkey, Pepperocini's.... and it was delicious! The combination of quality ingredients sandwiched between some amazing Semifreddo's French Bread made this an amazing sandwich. I just wish there was more meat (in general) on all of these sandwiches. 

Mission Picnic is better than most of it's popular neighborhood competitors, like Rhea's, Pal's Takeaway, and Ike's (whoa, I said it). Nothing in the area is quite like it, but in terms of delivering an amazing pastrami, I think I still like the Sandwich Place and Marina Subs. In terms of top notch quality ingredient sandwich, my heart is still with Salumeria and Roli Roti. For something really different, I enjoy options at Bite Me. 

I'm a sandwich snob, and yet with so many options in the neighborhood, I would recommend stopping at Mission Picnic for your Dolores Park supplies. No place has served up sandwiches quite like this - so glad to have Mission Picnic in the hood!
author: Jess C.

description:
I would've walked right past Mission Picnic if not for Yelp, so ... thanks, Yelp!

The vibe is super relaxed and friendly. Be warned that it's *tiny*, with maybe three or four tables for two at the most, so plan on taking your order to go. (Dolo is just a few blocks away!)

I had the Pollopesto sandwich, which aside from its namesake(s) is also stuffed with goat cheese, baby arugula, tomato, and lemon-chive oil (omg)--it was fresh, well-balanced, and delicious, and washed down perfectly with their cold watermelon juice. My friend had the vegan sandwich, which was also tasty but not quite as delightful as the Pollopesto (sorry, friend).

The next time I'm looking for something quick, portable, and tasty in the Mission and don't want a giant burrito (read: am sober), I'll be sure to stop by!
author: Angela L.

description: I ordered the beets and greens salad after hearing rave reviews. Although the concept of flavors were nice, I was surprised with the lack of ingredients for the price. The salad composed of mainly mixed greens, exactly 4 pieces of red beet, about a tablespoon of undercooked quinoa, a small sprinkle of goat cheese, and a few tidbits of apples/pears and pecans. For over $11, I was very disappointed.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
First time visitor, have heard about this place for awhile but was never able to see it until walking past one day.  The storefront is small, so small that if you blink you might miss it.  

Ordered to London Broil during peak lunch time madness, only a 10 min wait for the sandwich.  The beef was pretty good quality but the standout was the bread.  It was a crusty but soft french roll and everytime I took a bite it just took me back to Paris on the river.  Def. a small seating area and in an area that will be a bit of a hike to get to the closest neighborhood park.  

I'll be back, for the bread.
author: Kevin H.

description:
The menu is unique and caters to the pallets of many foodies here in San Francisco. 

Most ridiculous one here? Try 'The King' - Peanut butter, Chocolate, honey, bananas and...wait for it....Frosted Flakes?! Oh my - talk about awesome in a form of a heart attack. 

The San Franciscan is amazing. You simply cannot go wrong with this one. You got your Pastrami, turkey, provolone, tomatoes, red onion, peperoncinis, lettuce, mayo & mustard on a crunchy ciabatta bread. They were out of the French, but no complaints here! 

I Never got to try the Hainan Chicken everyone's been raving about :( Bring it back, please?! 

Note: Prepare to wait about 10-15 mins for your order and with only 3 small tables in the establishment, it's best to order to go or for pickup :) In short, I had a wonderful first experience here and would gladly pay $10 a sandwich any day for this place! TAKE ALL MY MONEY!!! *throws money*
author: Anh T.

description: My favorite sandwich place in all of SF!  Can't get enough of their sandwiches.  I didn't realize they actually sell out some days...so if they don't answer the phone that's why
author: Sara P.

description: Delicious sandwiches and sides! Reasonable priced too! The girls at the counter are nice and make you feel welcome!
author: Yedid G.

description: This place was delicious!  Based upon the other reviews, my husband & I headed over for lunch today - & it didn't disappoint!  We each ordered the San Franciscan sandwich and since the place is so small, we took them to go & walked to Dolores Park to enjoy them.  The sandwiches were perfectly flavored & had just the right amount of "crunch" when you bit into them.  Plus, they were filling!  We'll definitely be back to try more from the menu!
author: Karey B.

description: Have gotten a sandwich here a few times while working in SF. They have salads and sandwiches which are different and make for good eating. Their bread is always fresh and helps make the sandwich. Very small place and I always take out. I will be back
author: Linda M.

description: I have actually never been to this place in person so, I cannot speak to the cleanliness of the restaurant, parking, etc. I have ordered sandwiches from here several times and they're always really good. I usually order the Franciscan sandwich. With chips, a drink and delivery charges the total comes to about $23.00 and that is not including tip-- Expensive for a 1 person lunch, but hey, when you forget to bring your lunch and hunger sets in, $23.00 doesn't seem so bad for a hot and fresh sandwich. Delivery has usually taken between 15-20 minutes. Not bad at all.
author: Andreea M.

description:
Good sandwiches and salads, though a bit pricey. But, sandwiches are large and the quality is fairly high. Always a wait. Definitely call your order in ahead. 

I had accidentally tipped $250 for one sandwich on the iPad instead of $2.50. They called me almost immediately after I left to let me know my mistake and that they fixed it. THANK YOU!
author: Anna S.

description: The sandwiches here were nice.  We tried several, but none really stood out as being exceptional.  The bread was pretty good though.
author: Ryan B.

description: I stopped by here to pick up sandwiches for a picnic.  The pollopesto was amazing -- flavorful pesto, goat cheese, chicken, and tomato on crispy focaccia.  My friend enjoyed the vegan sandwich.  My only complaint is that the menu didn't specify that there'd be cheese in the side salad, so my vegan friend couldn't eat it.
author: Kellie O.

description: The sandwich I ordered was surprisingly good, way better than I expected. Nice happy employees, clean spot, all in all well worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Daniel H.

description:
The San Franciscan sando is so good, instead of a cup of water next to my bed at night, I put this sandwich on my night stand and eat that throughout the night. Not a true story, but the sandwich is incredibly amazing!

San Franciscan 9.50
hot romanian pastrami, roasted turkey breast, melted provolone, crunchy lettuce, tomato, red onion, pepperoncini, oil and vinegar, mayo, deli mustard on french
author: John R.

description: I haven't eaten here or been here but I used their delivery service today! $15 minimum + $3-$5 delivery fee; not too bad for delivery service. Wanted to surprise the bf with lunch while being 2,000 miles away. Called around the time they opened and explained the situation to the lady. She was really sweet and helpful. I was able to order and pay over the phone (including tip). The food was delivered to him within 45-60 min like she estimated.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Tried the San Franciscan, ABT, and London Broil, and all of them were super delicious. I'd definitely come back again!
author: Holly P.

description:
3.5 stars overall. Tasty sandwiches. Overpriced, like most in the City. 

They have some business operations issues that can be irritating. On multiple occasions, they have closed early or have been unexpectedly closed. Bummer if you've made a trip to specifically go there and had to deal with parking. 

They also run out of certain types of bread sometimes, which can result in odd combinations like pastrami on brioche.
author: Grammarian A.

description: sandwiches are okay. would be nice to mention on the menu that almost all sandwiches come with mayo. unfortunate surprise for someone who despises mayo
author: Gabriele L.

description:
pretty quick and reasonably priced

can't possible go wrong with the hot pastrami sandwiches, they're delicious :D

only a couple tables inside, so if you go in on the weekend, don't plan on being able to grab a seat.
author: Mike Q.

description:
Mission Picnic will now be my go-to spot for sandwiches. I tried the salmon, egg-salad, mozzpesto and vegan and they were all FANTASTIC. The bread were wonderful, I'm not even a fan of focaccia but this place made me enjoy focaccia! The french bread and brioche were heavenly! Also, the apple cider vinaigrette was so lovely! The quality of the ingredients were so fresh and so great! Honestly, I can't say enough. I love what they are doing and they are not at all pretentious or full of it! Just good ol' honest sandwiches (that are huge!!) and good prices. 

We also did catering with them for 200+ and boy, they knocked it out of the park! On time, nothing was soggy, quality was not compromised and everyone LOVED it! 

Thank you, Mission Picnic, you are a gem! XO
author: Foofa B.

description: A great place to grab a sandwich -- only complaint is with a couple of quality related issues that (IMHO) should be addressed and corrected if MP wants to stay on top of their game.  The rotisserie pulled chicken sandwich is a winner but the chicken is not actually from a rotisserie, at least the dryness of the chicken and the grill marks suggested otherwise,  Also, the cheddar was dry ad crumbly at the corners suggesting that it wasn't wrapped or stored properly.  Easy fixes and I think a little more attention to these details and a would go a long way into locking this place into the best sandwich spot in SF!
author: Eric O.

description:
Om nom nom, price for the sandwiches may be a bit high $9-11 but they are hella' delicious. I've tried to San Franciscan and the Club sandwich, both were great. The sandwiches are also pretty darn big, pick up a bag of chips and you've got yourself a meal. 

There's not much indoor seating so it's definitely better to grab your sammy to go, and enjoy it elsewhere. If you're looking for something quick and sandwhichy, then give this spot a try!
author: David C.

description: Came in on a Sunday @3pm when the time says they close at 4. The guy was on the phone and wasn't even looking with us standing there. It took him 4-5 mins to look at us. I asked him if they are closed and just nodded three other people in the store not wanting to respond.u still have an hour to close...but not interested in getting customers. Bad bad bad customer service!! No eye contact with waiting customers as you are too busy on the phone. I am never coming back here.
author: Alok A.

description:
Stopped by here on the way to Dolores Park for a 4th of July picnic. Great sando shop with a several good varieties. 

The Picnic Club -  There rendition of the club sandwich. Good portions of chicken, bacon and cheese. Fairly large overall and excellent taste. 

Hainan Chicken - Not bad at all. Flavors were there and again, it was a large sando. Careful on the pepper if you try it. It'll make you cry if you're spicy/pepper sensitive. Thankfully it's on the side and you can choose to add it or not. 

Salumi - Their take on an italian sando. I have to say, it's pretty darn good. The meats were flavorful and has a nice kick to it. The only small drawback is that it's a little oily. Other than that, it's a great sandwich! 

Overall Mission Picnic is a great addition to the area. It provides another spot of foodies to try and who doesn't like a good sandwich spot!?
author: Andrew S.

description: Solid club sandwich.  Always a fan of a place that includes pickles.  The bread could have been fresher and I think the chicken was INXS.
author: Jordan J.

description: Small place with limited seating. When I say limited I mean 3 tables against the wall with the people waiting in line a few inches away from you. However, they did a mean cranberry turkey sambo on a toasted roll. I wasn't expecting much but was very impressed with the sambo. They rotated out the hainan chicken which I wanted to try. The hubs got a salad and was not impressed - too much salad box stuffed to the brim without enough of the hearty stuff. Id say its a good place to quick up a sambo to go not dine in.
author: Melody T.

description: Awesome sandwiches - I never would have ordered the Cuban sandwich, but my boyfriend did, and the addition of grilled pineapple sort of blew my mind. Delicious! The watermelon juice was also excellent. Great spot to grab sammies!
author: Tasha D.

description:
Picnic without having to put together the picnic? Yes, please. 

Nice selection of well-made high quality sandwiches made to order. The sandwiches are good, and since they have "picnic" in the name it makes sense to get your picnic sandy here. At least it did for us.

Whether you're going to hang with the vagrants in Dolores Park or tripping up to wine country, hitting up Mission Picnic on the way is a good idea.
author: Marcus C.

description: Customer service was excellent and the sandwiches are delicious. The watermelon juice is so good. A must have
author: Courtney F.

description: Amazing customer service, fresh, flavorful and delicious sandwiches. I had the vegan sandwich and it was loaded with avocado, tomatoes, hummus, sprouts and other goodies. They were out of focaccia so I had it on ciabatta instead and I added some jalapeños for a little more of a kick which was perfect! About $12 for a big sandwich and fresh lemonade.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Came here for the first time with a friend and I loved it!! Didn't like how little seating there was, but at least it wasn't crowded.

I ordered the San Franciscan and it was amazing! Everything tastes very fresh and the bread was perfect. I will be sure to come back here! :)
author: Steven T.

description: Pastrami sandwich is the bomb. I saw other reviews talking about it I had to try it. I can only say you won't be disappointed
author: Emad G.

description:
I'm impressed. Great food! Excellent service! 

 I ordered sandwiches to be delivered to my office. I sent the order in around 9:30. 11 AM was available so I selected it as a delivery time. They open at 11 so I figured that they would call to confirm the order and tell me when the sandwiches would be delivered. No biggie. I had time. 

I get back to my office just after 11. I have a message. The delivery guy is in the lobby with the sandwiches! Wow! 

Even more shocking all 7 of my (let's be nice and call them persnickety) co-workers loved the food. I got the Picnic Club. The chicken. The bacon! Great sandwich! 

Thanks guys! We will be back!
author: KM R.

description:
This place is very cool, I'm pretty active at mission, sometime it gets really busy. I was hoping a restaurant that allows me to order online, and pick up right away, so I can save some time. 

One day I saw this small restaurant was packed, so I went in and look at the menu, they offer healthy sandwich and salad, when I was ordering it I saw they offer $1 off of you order through their app. 

I downloaded the app next time I was trying to order, it's pretty easy to set up and use, they take the order pretty quickly. It took about 10 mins for the whole process, which is pretty good. Right now when I'm on the way to mission, I just order it on my phone, pick it up by the time I get there. It's super handy. 

I wish they have more options though, overall, great place, cool idea! I like ordering food though my phone.
author: Dave Z.

description: Service was very friendly and fast. I got the Southerner sandwich, which was okay but a bit misleading entirely overpriced for what you get: on the menu is was described as "southern pork", and in the south that would mean something along the lines of pulled pork. Essentially it's just a ham and cheese sandwich, and not a very big one, for ten bucks. I also opted for a side of potato salad, and it was the worst potato salad I've ever tasted... it had the subtle taste of apples and processed cheese. Yuck. You can get a much better sandwich for the same price from other places nearby.
author: P U.

description:
I work nearby and pass every day so its amazing it took me so long to try it out.  So just gotta let you know that it was a great sandwich, I had the San Franciscan which was recommended by the pleasant lady behind the counter.  What I liked best is that the ingredients stayed together upon biting into the sandwich.  Some places, they make it so the ingredients squeeze out but these didn't.
