Here is a description of the Sandwich I ordered and note that I usually would not spend over $9 for a sandwich, but then again maybe you are not a cheapskate like me.
San Franciscan
9.50

hot romanian pastrami, roasted turkey breast, melted provolone, crunchy lettuce, tomato, red onion, pepperoncini, oil and vinegar, mayo, deli mustard on french
author: Jerome W.

description: Quality food but expensive for the portion size. Can't beat a hand-written note on a sandwich wrapping either.
author: Keith M.

description:
I _liked_ Mission Picnic, but I wasn't blown away. 

I had a caesar salad, which was fine. It wasn't anything to write home about, however.

The place is pretty small, so be forewarned. You place your order and hang out for about 15 minutes while PostMates cyclists push past you to grab their orders or small dogs nip at your ankles. All very Mission-y. 

Next time, I would choose the picnic club salad, but what can you do. I guess you'll have to back. :)

The good: sweet space. Really modern, I dig it.
The bad: a long wait for take out. 
Protip: take your food to Dolores. Soak in some sweet, sweet sun.
author: Amanda B.

description:
This place was an extremely pleasant surprise. Decided to try it because of the number of good reviews and couldn't have been happier. We had two sandwiches which don't seem to be on the menu anymore, one was peanut butter frosted flakes and honey, and the other was a rotisserie chicken sandwich of some sort.
I would highly recommend this place though be warned that the shop is very tiny.
author: Sara G.

description:
Had the chicken club and wasn't impressed. The ingredients were all good, but the sandwich was bland. And it was chicken salad, which I wasn't expecting.

I was disappointed that the sandwich wasn't hot either. Could've been better if it was hot.

Will I try again? Probably not.
author: Rich R.

description:
Not your average sandwich shop. With something so straightforward you would imagine that creativity is a challenge. Mission picnic is leading the pack in terms of diverging away from your standard sandwich and giving you a true experience. With a great selection, nothing here is boring and every single sandwich (I've tried all but the king) is as exciting as the next.

i do however have a list of favourites; the San Franciscan being the staple with which you will never be disappointed. When you're feeling a bit more daring the Nuevo Cubano is so different and so delicious. The Hainan is also a great one which I suggest you all try before it leaves the menu. My favourite salad is the beets and greens and the side of potato salad is a must with any order. 

There is so many good things to say about this place but I think what really stood out for me is the quality of the ingredients. I tried the new beef sandwich before I left and it literally melts in your mouth; thankfully they gave me a very generous portion of it. The staff are great, the atmosphere is nice and they deliver! It really is, for me, the best of its kind.
author: Ali B.

description:
small place with three tables.  rude clerk who just nods head to acknowledge guests.  really?  is that how ppl in the mission communicate? 

San Franciscan sandwich was a nice blend of two meats and good toasted bread.  Club you could skip.  

Clean bathrooms, but dusty lamp hovering over the aforementioned clerk.
author: PJ T.

description:
Mission Picnic ... Delicious breads, fresh ingredients.  They get the order right !   A tad pricey but the quality is worth it.  I honestly can say a very good sandwich.
I don't know if I am just picky, but I have a huge issue with consistency!  I hate it when I go somewhere anticipating the meal I had before only to see inconsistency.  Unfortunately I found that to be the case here also, although both slight variations were good lol.  They did get the order right but "more mayo"  less avocado"  more avodaco" bread too toasted.  Small things but as I said any variation WAS delish!
Over all clean and good customer service.
author: 415mama M.

description: A+ the best sandwich and nicest peeps, thank you Sterling!
author: Trishel M.

description:
I love mission picnic and I've never even eaten there. 
5 stars for customer service and you know the food is definitely good if it follows this awesome service. 

The long story short: tried surprising my friend with a bday lunch delivery and had to cancel (she was out to lunch after I placed the order). 

To the rescue: JENNIFER-so sweet, understanding, wonderful. 

THANK YOU JENNIFER and because of YOU I already love Mission picnic and will be planning to actually try the food soon!
author: Kim D.

description:
I heard many good things about Mission Picnic since it first opened. Excited to try a new place with such great reviews, and so near our typical haunt of the Mission Mercato on Thursdays, the boyfriend and I ventured to Mission Picnic on a Thursday late afternoon/evening to get some togo sandwiches. The place is small and we were the only patrons since it was an odd hour (probably around 4:30 or 5). We were lucky enough to be served by the owner and he recommended for us to try the Club and the Hainan Chicken. 

The sandwiches did take a while to be made but I'm always okay with waiting for food to be prepared fresh. While we were waiting, the owner chatted us up as there was someone else there to make the sandwiches, Jose, who also works at Pal's Takeaway. Apparently, the owner is half Chines, half French and we learned that once when he was three years old, his mother found him pounding flour into the carpet while watching Jacque Pepin. Interesting. 

Anyway, we took the sandwiches home and were excited to dig in, but it was just a very underwhelming experience. The ingredients seemed well thought out, but it just didn't have that it factor that would make me return to a place. The Hainanese seemed a bit dry, not enough flavor, not vinegary or savory enough. I suppose it's a good option in the area, but it's not a destination for me. I walk past this place all the time and don't really have anything causing me to return anytime soon.
author: Victoria J.

description: Loveeeee that chicken club, staff were quick and attentive.
author: Khalid M.

description:
I love sandwiches. Like, I really effing love them. It's probably a comfort thing with me, as my Mom used to make my sisters and I sandwiches when we were little, but wherever my love stems from, it's true, devoted, unadulterated love. 

But I've never fallen in love with a sandwich in San Francisco. Yes, I've found sandwiches that I like - even sandwiches that I crave - but nothing I LOVE. 

I just stopped eating Mission Picnic's Devil's Egg Sandwich halfway through to write this review. That's how glorious this sandwich is. I absolutely HAD to let the world know how much they're missing by not having my bite of sandwich in their own mouth. I have little bits of egg and bacon stuck to my face as I type this, and I'm feeling no shame. 

It's that good. 

LIFE TIP: They deliver - your excuses are null and void.
author: Mel H.

description:
Mission Picnic is the perfect stop before heading to the park. There are only a couple 2-person tables inside, so it's definitely more of a to-go place. 

I ordered the nuevo cubano. It was under $10 and only took about 5 mins to come out. The sandwich tastes like Hawaiian pizza, it was awesome. The bread is perfect and the pickled onions were incredible. Who would have known pickled red onions are such a great ingredient? 

Every bit as good as Ike's, but without the line. Well played, Mission picnic. Well played.
author: K M.

description:
Stumbled across this place and fell in love. This is the kind of everything-house-made original-menu place that makes our neighborhoods so special. It's a sandwich shop. In the same way that Chez Panisse is a new American local food place. Everything they make is unique, interesting, and tasty. For about 8 bucks you can get a great sandwich that's unlike anything you've ever had in a deli or an ordinary sandwich shop. 

I had a tuna sandwich with "double cucumber" and a spicy curry. The owner made it to order, so it took about 5 minutes. The flavors and textures balanced perfectly. This was 4 days ago. I still remember that sandwich. I'll be back to try another. Yay!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Got the mozzapesto, it was good. I wasn't terribly impressed with the bread and I thought the slices of mozzarella could have been a little more substantial. Pesto was excellent and roasted peppers a nice touch.

I would definitely go back but probably wouldn't order the mozzapesto again.
author: Cole G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

I work a block and a half away and I end up going here for lunch at least once a week. It's so good, I'm addicted.  I love both the sandwiches and the salads. 

All the ingredients are really fresh and they use really good ingredients in everything.  I can't even give you what my favorite meal is because everything is so good.
author: Dana M.

description:
My wife and I wanted to try a different sandwich place so we came here and had the Hainan Chicken as well as their San Franciscan. 

The Wait: Considering it was 2PM on a Monday, I was surprised at how long it took for them to make two sandwiches. It always amazes me to see the differences efficiency of various sandwich shops -- even those with diverse menus. This wasn't as bad as Ike's but the wait for the sandwich was still positively glacial compared to Roxy's or 1058 Hoagie

As far as the sandwiches themselves were concerned: there are plenty of better Banh Mi options compared to the Hainan chicken and the San Franciscan wasn't nearly as good as Deliboard (which IMO, still isn't as good as their sister shop 1058 Hoagie).

At this price point, I think Roxy's, Rhea's, 1058 Hoagie, or two Banh Mi sandwiches would be a better meal. I don't anticipate going back.

-g
author: Gunn S.

description:
Mission Picnic features a simple menu that focuses on sandwiches. All sounded really appealing and I somehow settled on the Hainan chicken - mostly because I love Hainan chicken and to see it in a sandwich seemed inventive and unusual. 

I'm not sure if they cook the chicken in the traditional Hainanese way where the chicken is steeped in chicken bone stock, but let me tell you, that chicken in the sandwich was super moist and flavorful, much like a traditionally prepared Hainan chicken.

In fact, it might be the juiciest chicken I've had in a sandwich. 

Mission Picnic is worth a visit. Perfect opportunity to grab a sandwich and head to the park.
author: Lee H.

description:
Service Review:

First time order at this place and what a disappointment! I ordered the Chicken Caesar Salad and London Broil Sandwich to go on April 27. And upon arriving at this place, the cashier did not even say a word and just blindly stare at me. I understand it was Sunday afternoon and he probably is hung-over from last night party or something. But you don't have to be so cold and no emotion on his face whatsoever. For some reason, I thought he included utensil in the salad box. Nope, not a single fork or napkin. It's such a joke to found out you can't enjoy your food at picnic because you got no fork.

Food Review:

I would give Mission Picnic 0 star if I could, but the food here are decent. To be fair, the chicken salad at this place is exceptionally good. The parmesan and crouton pair perfectly that gives you crunchiness and chewiness at the same time. The sandwich was OK, just like any other industrialized sandwich you got from Safeway.
author: Kenny O.

description:
There is certainly no shortage of "craft" sandwich shops in the city these days (Ike's, Deli Board, Melt, etc.) and Mission Picnic manages to stand out. 

I've tried 3 which were all terrific and I'm aiming to try every sandwich on the menu because I believe they'll all be great. Get there.
author: David C.

description: Tiny little sandwich shop. Smells of bacon and bread. The Nuevo Cuban sandwich is great. Super fresh tasting and the bread is just baked, adding to the overall experience.
author: Danielle O.

description: These guys are fantastic! Our girl scout troop was in SF this weekend and we needed sandwiches early Saturday morning. They accommodated our order and had it delivered and even earlier than expected! Thank you Mission Picnic, I will be sure to recommend you to our service unit back home who attend this event in SF every year!
author: KarenQ W.

description: Despite the spot being a hole in the wall, it is clean and all the ingredients are fresh and of high quality - from the tomato, arugula, bread to....you name it! Bread is done crispy but not dry. I got the London Broil (the roast beef sandwich) and the meat was tender, good portioned, and a great match with the aioli!
author: Christina H.

description:
I am on a perpetual hunt for the ideal sandwich. How lucky for me that I just discovered a new gem. Stumbled upon Mission Picnic on my walk home and returned the next day for a big honkin' chicken bahn-mi style sammy. That chicken must be organic and where do they get the rolls? Better than just an Acme bread. 

And a big sandwich, too. Saving the other half for my dinner tonight. Can't believe I'm so fortunate to have these guys in my 'hood. 

And, as the name implies, they're just right for a picnic in the park or on a Valencia parklet. If you're in the Mission for Sundday Streets this weekend, take a half-block detour off of Valencia onto 22nd and you're there!
author: maureen f.

description: I've been looking for a good sandwich shop for years in SF. This is my favorite one. Really well-balanced,
author: Peter J.

description:
I ordered the Hainan Chicken sandwhich.  Maybe I got unlucky but I found a dressed-up vietnemese sandwhich with uncooked chicken in it.  I order my steaks rare, but I don't play with raw poultry, had to toss most of it.  

My buddy got the roast beef and swiss called "SGT Slaughter", it comes with a teriyaki slaw on it, the slaw is billed as spicy, but it's not, it's sweet and tangy, which makes it difficult to eat on swiss cheese and beef.  My buddy swallowed it out of hunger, but was grabbing his stomach afterward.  

The girl behind the counter was clueless, she took 2 huge phone orders between taking my order and my buddies, so that my sandwhich came out in 5 minutes and we had to wait around for 20 minutes for my buddies sandwich to come out......clueless help, I want my tip back.
-minimal seating
-Avg price of a sandwich:  $10
-So many better sandwich options in this neighborhood
author: Alex M.

description: First time in this place. I love it!! Awesome bread and fresh ingredients. Fare price, the sandwich was quite big.
author: Lizbeth C.

description: EXCELLENT!! - visiting here for work in SF in the financial district and had limited options for my team on a Sunday, but I'm so glad I found Mission Picnic on yelp.  Really good, fresh ingredients, a unique vibe.  They were really nice when I called, fast delivery.  Will DEFINITELY be ordering for my group again.  YUMMMMM.
author: Cindi M.

description:
San Francisco's hottest sandwich shop is Mission Picnic.  It has everything.  Creative yet intuitive flavors, friendly staff, chutes, ladders, the outdoor concert from a Zoloft commercial...

Sorry, I couldn't resist.  Anyway, I went today and ordered the Sgt. Slawter, and it was definitely in my top 20 sandwiches of all time (which is really saying something for me!).  It was the perfect combination of textures and flavors, juicy but not enough to make the bread soggy.  The teriyaki slaw with roast beef is brilliant, particularly when paired with dutch crunch and a garlic/herb spread.  The meat was exceptional: very thin and juicy with some real flavor.  This is some high-quality stuff, not your typical grocery-store cold cuts.

Previously, I've ordered the Hainan Chicken, which was good but didn't blow my mind like the Slawter did.

My only hang-up is the price.  It's just hard for me to justify spending $8.50 on a sandwich, even when it is amazing.  This is the only reason I won't be eating at Mission Picnic on a daily basis.  I'm not saying it's overpriced, just that it's too expensive for me to eat here as regularly as I'd like.  

You can really tell that the food here is made with care and quality ingredients.  I haven't seen such inventive and new flavor pairings in a sandwich shop, and I've eaten a lot of sandwiches.  The bottom line: go, and get the Sgt. Slawter.  And a watermelon juice if you're in the rare situation of not knowing to do with all of your extra money.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Best sandwiches in the city! I could live on the pollo pesto.
Also the watermelon juice is unique, delicious, and refreshing...
author: Tiffany S.

description: The staff here are the nicest in the Mission! I have had a handful of their regular sandwiches, but have found my favorite in the cranberry turkey. Thanksgiving year-round. Mmmmmm.. They've got the softest most delicious bread on the egg salad sandwich too!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I want to share my best find at this place. 
HAINAN CHICKEN SANDWICH! 

It's delicious.... 

The sandwich has incredibly tasty garlic rotisserie chicken with cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce on the Dutch crunchy bread - mmmmm, heaven!
author: Olga B.

description: We ordered a Kale Caesar salad and a San Franciscan sub. The salad was super disappointing; a single anchovy, barely any Kale or tomatoes and mostly lettuce.
author: Jaco L.

description:
Hubby and I came by to pick up a few sandwiches before heading to Dolores Park for a nice afternoon in the sun.  

We ordered the San Franciscan, Hainan Chicken, and their version of the desert sandwich (bananas, chocolate, peanut butter, and frosted flakes) for our little girl.  The sandwiches were delicious!  They were still nice and warm and the bread was crunchy on the outside and soft inside when we got the park.  The San Franciscan was well made while the chicken in the Hainan was very tender and moist.  I actually really like the desert sandwich when I snuck a bite from my little girl.  The fresh juices also paired well.

This is definitely our new go to place before heading to Dolores Park.
author: Mac S.

description: Not a big fan of writing 1 star Yelp review but terrible customer service experience leaves me no choice. I've ordered from this place for delivery numerous times and enjoyed the food. This time around I was in the neighborhood and decided to stop by the physical location and WOW I was left speechless. I double checked online prior to showing up that they open at 11am, I come in at 11:15 to see the cashier screening at someone "what do you want from me I don't know what is missing from your order it's not my order" as I'm patiently waiting to place my order. A couple of minutes go by and she finally acknowledges me "we aren't open for another 15 minutes" she rudely says to me, I follow up by telling her it says online they open at 11 am to which she replies "yeah not today." At this point I walk out the door and have no intention on EVER coming back to this place which is really unfortunate because I really liked salads they have.
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
I was just griping to a friend that it's hard to find a great sandwich in San Francisco.  Plenty of "good" places, but no "great!" places.

Well, Mission Picnic is GREAT!  Every sandwich I've tried has been outstanding.  The menu changes regularly, to match the fresh fixin's they've got in the kitchen that day.  They've always got a few offerings to satisfy the less adventurous, as well as a choice feature or two for the foodies that haunt every corner of SF.  

It's not cheap ... but, in the San Francisco scheme-of-things, it's not that expensive either.  Expect to pay $10-$15 for a sandwich and a drink.

On top of Mexican Coke and other typical drinks, they have great/simple fruit drinks - basically, fresh fruit they blend on-the-spot with ice.  Simple, refreshing.  Try one, you won't regret it.

Be warned - there isn't a ton of seating, and that that is available isn't spacious.  But, you can always find a park (or, a Mission Parklet) to grab a seat.
author: peter a.

description:
I absolutely LOVE the sandwiches here.  My personal favorite is the San Franciscan- pastrami and oven baked turkey with lovely melted provolone on a great french bun with peperocinis which gives it a perfect zing!  The Picnic Club is also fantastic with the chicken salad and bacon and lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and cheddar.  It's so big too!! I can usually stretch it into two meals! :-)  Also the Albacurry is delicious, it's got a Thai style curry flavour that is in almost a sloppy joe style sandwich that has some really great pickled cabbage and cucumbers. 

The salads that they come up with are so yummy as well, they currently have a chicken Caesar that is out of this world amazing!! And the portion is perfect, too!!  They have a lovely soup that changes daily.  OH! And sometimes they have banana bread pudding and if you can get your hands on that- sooooooo delicious!! :-) 

So hurry up and go try out the grub here!! nom nom nom!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Tough spot if you're gluten-free. The sandwiches look good; I just wish they had better salads!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
AHHH-MAZINGGGGG sandwiches at this new place - Mission Picnic has GOT_it_GOING_On.

Their picnic club was hands down the most succulent chicken sandwich amazing creation I've ever tasted - how do they make that chicken so tender?  Probably because they know what their doing.  Facts.  

The worker bees and owners is cool as all hell (and most likely working) - straight cuties.  The music is awesome - thanks MP for playing the good beats.

Try them for a catering event!  They will accommodate.  Check out their website, its friendly.

Go to Mission Picnic, right NOW HOMIE :)
author: Jana S.

description:
Me and my friends went here for their grand opening last week.  Their sandwiches are creative and suited the whimiscal names given to each.   One sandwich that definitely stood out was their Hainan Chicken sandwich (we also tried their Picnic club, Devil's egg, and San Franciscan).  What made the Hainan different was that it had an Asian flair to it, but made modern into a sandwich.  The dutch crunch was toasted lightly and the chicken wasn't too dry; but was juicy and savory when paired with the secret sauce that came with it.   

Aside from the sandwiches, their watermelon juice was delicious =D

What made this place even more enjoyable, are the staff themselves.  The owners are very approachable and easy-going.  They make sure that every sandwich you order is made to perfection!  

Definitely worth the trip out to the Mission.
author: Jessica L.

description: Love this little hipster joint with tasty specialty sandwiches. Got the Nuveno Cubano and it was SOOOO good. I liked the sweetness of the pineapple mixed with a small kick of spice from the jalopeno aioli. It's a bit pricey for a sandwich (~$8-$10), but I think it's worth the treat every now and then. Definitely coming back!!
author: Elaine Y.

description: There's a lot of rave and crave here and I won't be a hater.  It's good.  It's solid.  And it's a sandwich.
author: David S.

description: Sandwiches are good. But customer service should step it up a notch! If you want repeating customers you should make them feel more welcoming into your establishment. Very small store and only three tables to eat on which other people in line continue to bump your elbows. Thanks But No Thanks!
author: MENG D.

description: I stumbled on this place on my way to Dolores park. The menu is tight, the bread is fresh and crunchy and the service was friendly. It's not super convenient for a lunch in the park, but with the extra block walk!
author: Kylie F.

description: It started off on a good ole' Saturday with the girls in San Francisco.  The day seemed perfect for a sandwich so we came across this new deli.  Mind you guys that Im a big fan of sandwiches, I travel far and wide in search of a good sandwich!  The sandwiches here?  Amazing.  They create these amazing sandwiches with quality products.  Everything from the inside to the outside is just perfect.  The bread is toasted to an amazing perfection.  The meat and everything else just works PERFECTLY  all together.  All of their selections are great.  Their juice is great too :) if you're looking for the best deli sandwich in San Francisco, this is hands down the right place to go to.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Ever since I moved to the Bay Area, I have made it my mission to try a few new dining establishments per week. I have heard nothing but amazing things about a quaint sandwich shop called Mission Picnic. So this passed Friday I saddled up and headed down to the Mission to check it out. The neighborhood was very eclectic and had an interesting mix of shops. The staff at Mission Picnic was very polite, patient and thoughtful in recommending a sandwich to fit my tastes. With some consulting,I selected the San Franciscan, which was amazing. A nice mix of meats and great blended flavors. It was so good, I decided to grab another sandwich for the road! This time I chose the CranTurkey. Equally as delicious, light and very fresh. I have recommended MP to all of my friends and our next corporate lunch will definitely be Mission Picnic catered!
author: Elvis N.

description: The cobb salad is a winner - savory chunks of chicken, fresh avocado, crispy bacon slices, hardboiled eggs and a homemade vinaigrette. Sparse seating but friendly customer service. I'm already looking forward to eating another salad here.
author: Nan H.

description: Great sandwiches, impossibly succulent and the bread is also great. It's tiny but if you can get a table it's actually a decent place to consume your sandwich, while listening to some good tunes
author: Miguel P.

description: I had been wanting to try food from here since they opened. I finally got my chance when I decided to order lunch in for my boyfriend and I on our day off. I ordered the San Franciscan sandwich and the Beets and Greens salad. Both were delicious! The meat was sliced so thin on the sandwich and the crust of the bread was so crunchy with the inside was soft and tasty. Both of us were thoroughly impressed and super full! Will definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Ariel B.

description: Mission Picnic was an amazing find meandering around the Mission. The Albacurry sandwich was all kinds of yummy, and really filling. Why someone didn't think to put curry and tuna together is beyond me. The Orzo salad was super rich and creamy. Definitely worth waiting the 15 minutes to get my sandwich. I wish I lived in SF to eat here all the time!
author: Daniel E.

description:
This place opened not long ago & I've decided to give it a try.  So glad I did because this place is amazing!! I really like their setup and their menu was simple & appealing. 

It was a lot to chose from but I settled in on the picnic club sandwich with rotisserie chicken salad.  The ciabatta was soft but crunchy exactly how it should be. It was delicious!! Everything was fresh & flavorful and I knew  I was being serve the best quality of food and services. Everything was excellent and everyone there was upbeat and friendly. 

One of the best sandwich places in SF.  This place was beyond my expectations. What awesome find in the mission neighborhood...seriously, everyone need to give this neat place a try!
author: Angela W.

description: We ordered a huge lunch order for our office and although there were some inconsistencies with the Eat24 menu and their website menu. They called me to let me know were super nice and easy to deal with. Everything was exactly how we ordered and it came pretty quickly considering it was lunch time and we ordered for about 18 people. The salads are really big and filling and everyone really liked the bread. We will probably order from here again :)
author: Autumn L.

description: Whenever I'm in the area craving a sammie, the San Franciscan is my go to sandwich :D It has the perfect balance of meat/veggie/bread ratio and with the melted cheese and toasty bread it's just an amazing marriage of flavors in my mouth... I love washing it down with their watermelon juice and for a nice sweet treat after, the chocolate chip cookie, YUMMMM. What more can I possibly ask for? Nada :D
author: Laura L.

description:
I love this place!

The sandwiches are so so delicious and filling. I usually get the turkey cran and it does not disappoint. It's a perfect blend of turkey, cranberry sauce, and sprouts & other veggies that create the perfect texture and flavor combinations. 

I've had the ABT and while it definitely satisfied my bacon craving (hello double bacon!), the toasted rosemary foccacia was a little rough on my mouth. Personally, this sandwich is better eaten in halves like an open-face. 

I've only ordered to-go because the place is quite small and can easily get crowded. Luckily they work through the line quickly.
author: Eilene G.

description:
Ordered the Devil's Egg and Premium Vegan sandwiches for delivery through Eat 24. Around two minutes after order placement, I get a call from the Mission Picnic saying they're out of the Devil's Egg. Okay, that's fine. I changed to the ABT. Again, a minute later, another call saying they're out of focaccia bread and they only have French loaves left. WTF? Fine, I'll deal. However, I specified for the Premium Vegan to have NO ONIONS! What does the sandwich come with when delivered? A field of HORRID RED ONIONS! At this point, I'm livid and pick off each piece of onion. I vow never to order for delivery again.

The sandwiches merit the prices and flavor is good, not great. I ate half of the Vegan, onionless sandwich and my breath reeks of ONIONS!  Delivery service was quick because I received my order with 20 minutes. Delivery guy was very nice. Service reps at the store are another story! READ ORDER SPECIFICATIONS THOROUGHLY POR FAVOR!
author: Kim N.

description:
Chicken pesto sandwich = amazing.

Everything this place makes = incredible

Waiting 20 minutes for a sandwich = lame

That is all.
author: Braden B.

description:
Great selection of salads and sandwiches.... The good ones too, with some thought put into the ingredients, flavors that mesh well.  
I read a review and someone complained about the quality of the chicken... the chicken on my Cobb salad was picked very nicely, (no fatty or unpleasant pieces), and the lettuce seemed as though it hadn't been chopped the day before like most places. The salad was $10.50 which seems reasonable considering what was in it. 
They seemed decently busy, so it took a little longer than I expected, and someone who ordered after I did got their order before I did, so I almost had to dock a star, but great place, great fresh ingredients.
author: Shawn B.

description: Walked by this place and it was packed.  Decided to see what all the commotion was about.  I ordered the chicken cobb salad and fell in love!  The following week decided to make a trip over and I was so disappointed when I got back to my desk and my salad resembled nothing like my first one.  The bacon was missing, the salad dressing was completely different from the first time.  I called over and was assured they wanted to make things right.  Was told the next time I came in the salad would be on the house.  Mission picnic kept their word.  I ordered a sandwich as well.  Both were delicious.  I think a little more consistency would be good.  My salad was delicious, but again, it was different from the 2 previous times.
author: sumaya g.

description: Delicious! Ordered delivery for a meeting at the office and we all agreed, super yummy. The food was fresh and arrived when we requested, the dude even came up to our floor! We will forsure be ordering again from here. A great twist on some classics (we ordered the Cobb, Caesar, Cranturkey, and Mozzapesto). Loved it.
author: Kat H.

description: I've never been, but I placed a phone order earlier today and I couldn't be happier with the way I was treated.  Sterling, the owner, personally took my phone order and was very pleasant and accommodating.  Thank you so much, and the next time I'm in SF, I'll make sure to stop in and try the food!
author: Muhammad E.

description: Wow, they immediately turned things around. Still pricey, but cheers for being responsive!
author: Joe D.

description: Mission Picnic has amazing sandwiches.  To be honest, I've only ever had the Picnic Club, and I am so satisfied with it that I have no desire to branch out.  The chicken salad defines what a chicken salad should be, and the tomatoes are fresh.  It's best to call in ahead of time or order online so you don't have to wait, and since there are only a few tables it's often better to get take out.  The sandwiches are so large they will probably last you through almost 2 meals.  My roommates say the San Franciscan, London Broil, and Pollopesto are excellent choices as well.
author: Rachel A.

description: Easily the best sandwich place in San Francisco. A lot of different options of meet and veggies. Great customer service highly recommended.
author: Serge B.

description: We ordered our food through eat24 and had it delivered,  the food was still hot. We ordered a Cranturkey sandwich, it was delicious, the sourdough bread was amazing. ..it's so hard to find good hard sourdough rolls!!!
author: Courtney V.

description: The watermelon drink is literally the best non-alcoholic drink in the city.
author: Quinn D.

description: We had Mission Picnic today for the first time!  It was fantastic!  I work at a medical office in the Castro and they delivered to us.  The owner delivered our lunch himself.  Very impressive!  He was extremely nice!   He also handed me a coupon for their event on March 29th.  The menu isn't that big but I like that, so one doesn't get overwhelmed with what to order.  I had a winter wedge salad and the Picnic club sandwich.  So fresh and tasty!  My co-workers all loved their salads and sandwiches.  We will for sure be ordering from them again soon!!   Thank you Mission Picnic!!
author: Rudy L.

description: One reviewer called this "a tad pricey" and I'm going to chalk that up to all of the young tech money in the neighborhood. Three stars for a tasty (turkey/cran) sandwich, albeit way too much mayo. Lemonade crazy sweet. Two stars lost for the price tag and imbalance of the aforementioned ingredients. Walked out with a sandwich and drink for over $13...no side, no salad, no chips. Meh.
author: Maria G.

description: Best BLT in town, hands down. I had been laying off the bread and this sandwich was more crisp bacon than bread! I'm too young for a heart attack so why not do it now.
author: Frank H.

description: Delicious food! I have ordered delivery from here twice, and each time I got the same thing, because I loved it so much! I get the arugula side salad and the mozzpesto sandwich on their rustic french bread! Every bite is perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious! One of the best sandwich and salad combos I've ever had!
author: Stefanie S.

description: I love this place! Mission Picnic got me to eat a Vegan Sandwich. I LIKED IT. I highly recommend Mission Picnic for catering your event! Mission Picnic has an outstanding staff and super tasty sandwiches--our favorites are the ABT and the Picnic Club. I heard many good things about Mission Picnic since it first opened
author: Sebastian H.

description: A nice change from the usual sandwiches. Fun, inventive and delicious. I had the Nuevo Cubano sans Avocado Jalapeño Aioli, and added their delicious bacon to the mix. Delish. Service was awesome and they helped me select a sandwich I would like, only problem, it was hot and the paper it's wrapped in got condensation and ripped apart in my backpack. I wasn't offered a bag. Kinda ruined my sandwich but I'll still go back and eat in next time.
author: William D.

description: I have loved every single sandwich I've tried here. I have been ordering the chicken caesar salad lately, and it always fills me up! Give this place a shot, and you will smile through the entire experience.
author: Chase L.

description: This place is so promising (nice ambiance, friendly), but I've tried most of their sandwiches and many of their sides and I still haven't found one that I'd go back for. Their sandwiches tend to be pretty dry and lacking in any real deep meaning or taste. I bought one of their salads and there just wasn't enough dressing--I had to go home and re-dress it. Do try their cran-turkey, though; that one is pretty good.
author: Keito U.

description:
Plus for interesting combinations.
Minus for value and small portions on the sammies.
(especially in competition with a good nearby burrito or slice.)

Suggestion:  sandwiches of this perceived caliber should come with a good pickle.
author: Jag A.

description: Really yummy but expensive and the ingredients are not worth it. I asked them about their meat, if it was hormone free, organic, etc. they looked at me with disdain and said it was just "meat." Ok, fine but then what am I paying so much for? Not seating (the 3 tables are always taken) not service (it's slow and they are sorta rude) and not high quality ingredients.
author: A R.

description: The service here is incredibly bad, waited nearly a half an hour for a sandwich. A sandwich that isn't any better than something you could get any old sandwich shop. To top it off this place isn't exactly cheap and for the amount of time you'll spend waiting it's not worth it. In a neighborhood with plenty of options you'd do well to seek other places out.
author: Joe N.

description: Average sandwich shop. Was super excited to try it out because of the number of stars. FYI they don't serve Dutch Crunch anymore and their sandwiches are heavy on the mustard...not a big fan.
author: Katie M.

description: Great sandwiches, I love this place. I've only been twice, but both times have been good. The first time I got the San Franciscan, which was good - nice size, great bread, plenty of meat inside. The second time I got the Devil's Egg, which was fantastic. I love egg salad, and this egg salad is particularly nice. It is certainly not a generic egg salad sandwich.
author: Ryan C.

description: After seeing the reviews, I was pretty excited to give them a try and hopefully add them to my roster for company lunches.  Not only did they deliver an entire day early, but on the actual day it was originally ordered for...I requested my order to be delivered by 11:30am and here I am writing this review at 12:28pm and my order is still nowhere to be found. My lunch meeting started at noon so our attendees are not pleased. I just started at this new job about a month ago...thanks for making me look bad Mission Picnic!
author: Kayla C.

description: Ordered delivery for office lunch and it came fifteen minutes early. Rodeo salad was delicious!
author: Shalin M.

description:
a great place that is so convenient to get a quick lunch. i had the lentil soup and peach salad which were both very tasty with a homemade feel. i loved the freshness and it the spot for this nursing hungry mama. i know i will be frequenting here for a quick meal. 

**i am glad that they have a $10 min for credit card - it forced me to get more food :)
author: Rachna P.

description: A little disappointed after reading the reviews that were so super.  I got the Cesar salad with chicken.  I ordered some extra dressing on the side as well but the dressing was pretty scarce.  The croutons tasted much like you get out of a box and the lettuce and dressing wasn't anything special.  The chicken was also kind of dry and not like freshly grilled chicken is supposed to taste like.  They should grill fresh chicken and put it on the salad and the dressing should be made from scratch each day including some more anchovy, garlic and mustard flavor.  Next time I'll try a sandwich, just wish there were some Organic choices, damn we're in SF, get with it :)
author: Mitch A.

description: Great sandwiches and salads, made with fresh ingredients, prepared quickly... What else do you need?
author: Jesse H.

description: San Franciscan was pretty tasty but a bit expensive. Only three tables so it's best for carry out.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Sterling @ Mission Picnic is seriously the BEST. He is now my go-to caterer whenever I need to plan lunch for the office/off-sites/meetings etc. The sandwiches are SO good and the salads are phenomenal as well- all really great quality. Mission Picnic is definitely a crowd pleaser.
author: Kristin A.

description: Creative sandwiches with quality ingredients. What originally brought me in was the Hainan Chicken sandwich. Hainan Chicken is a dish which is popular in some places but difficult to find in San Francisco. Turns out that this place captured a lot of the flavor of that dish in a sandwich. I have been happy with everything I have tried here. Also, the location is central to just about anywhere you would want to bring a sandwich on a nice day in the mission. Grab a Hainan Chicken sandwich and a coconut water and head to the park... NOW!
author: Eric G.

description: I absolutely love this place! I order online a lot with coworkers and they deliver.  They have delicious, healthy, and not as healthy sandwiches.  Their beet salad is my favorite!  I call the staff sometimes to add or change my order and they are very friendly.  I have no complaints so far!
author: Celeste A.

description:
Today was my first visit to Mission Picnic. Prices ranged about 9-10 dollars for a sandwich. There are only three tables so you best to expect to take it out. 

I had the Southerner which was just okay. My husband had the london broil which he absolutely loved. That is saying something for him, very picky.

The people working there were extremely friendly and helpful. I made a few changes on my sandwich, (maybe that was why it was just okay), and they had no problem with that.

With any restaurant, you are never going to get everyone to agree and love it. I would say go try it and see for yourself. It was good with fresh ingredients and very filling.

I will be back.
author: michelle b.

description: Love the London Broil and Mozzopesto sandwiches. I tried the Pollopesto sandwich, but it's a bit on the dry side.
author: Amin S.

description: Yummy huge less than $10 sandwiches and salads, great to have a mission place for a casual lunch. Tiny shop, maybe 4 or 5 two-tops, so pick up or go early
author: Aki N.

description: Mission Picnic has an outstanding staff and super tasty sandwiches--our favorites are the ABT and the Picnic Club. We love the sandwiches because the ingredients are fresh, generous, and put together with care. Breads are perfectly toasted, bacon is always crispy, and deli meats are top quality. Though we love the sandwiches, the incredibly kind and friendly staff are what keep us coming back. We are always welcomed with a smile (we love Jennifer!) and the place has a happy, upbeat vibe. Highly recommend Mission Picnic!
author: Suzanne G.

description:
I've been here a little over a dozen times and it never disappoints. Might be my favorite sandwiches in the city. I'm personally a huge fan of the nuevo cubano but the hainan chicken is also pretty good. Haven't tried the peanut butter banana sandwich but I am always tempted.

There's not one obvious reason I give it 5 stars - it's just all those subtle aspects of the execution done right - the bread and sandwich ingredients are super fresh, the sandwich construction is balanced and the bread is always toasted to perfection. They offer some unique sandwich combinations and it's obvious they care about what they're serving you.

The inside of the place isn't anything special and there isn't a ton of seating, so I usually get sandwiches to go and wander around somewhere. If you're hungry, you can't really go wrong here.
author: Josh S.

description: The Picnic Club is quite good, and I also had the soup of the day which was a vegan cream of broccoli.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Love love the food but the delivery is always late. I waited 1.4 hours today for my food. If delivery was faster, it would be a solid 5-star.
author: Mehdi A.

description: I really like this place. It's very simple, but really tasty and good sandwiches. They are fast and fair prices as well.
author: Yuri N.

description: Blue cheese....!!!! Omg I would never try this cheese ever but I accidentally tried it from the peach salad that my friend had order. It wasn't bad at all. Despite the fact that I got to try something new, the taste of the sandwich (The San Franciscan) here really hit the spot. Must try!
author: Sinath N.

description: Yummy!!!!  Hubs and I happened on this place while searching for a sandwich joint near Dolores park.  On our way there, we literally walked in to the Sunday Streets festival, so that was also kind of exciting.  Anyway, it's a small place - seats 8 inside.  The menu offers something for everyone, but we decided to share the Hainan Chicken sandwich.  It was so DELICIOUS!  Definitely enough for two as a light lunch.   Because we checked in, we also scored a watermelon juice.  Service was great.  Prices are reasonable (less than $9 for said 'wich and most everything was along the same price point). I can't fault this place one bit!
author: Amber E.

description: Great ambiance. Visiting from LA found this place on yelp. Sat outside enjoyed the weather the food was good. Not to mention they serve beer and mimosas at 10am!
author: Christy S.

description: $9 for a bland sandwich that took 30+ minutes to make? Bread was hard as a rock, and no flavor anywhere in my Picnic Club.
author: Mehul T.

description: Every sandwich I've had from here is mmmmm delicious. I took my grandmother who lives in Nebraska here and she even said it's "the best bread I've ever tasted," which is saying a lot since she's had her fair share of homemade delicious bread. My fav thus far is probably The San Franciscan although the Sergeant Slawter is a very close second. Only downside is if you go late in the day they can be out of certain ingredients, but they usually find a very tasty substitute for you.
author: Sarah O.

description:
Good, tasty, creative ingredient sandos.  Devil's Egg (egg salad) was solid.

Took awhile to make 'em.  Probably worse during height of lunch rush.  

Min $10 credit card is lame... get Square going on there yo.
author: Henry F.

description: Fast delivery. 30 mins only! But the proportions for the potato and pesto salad are so disappointing, small as heck! The other salads are normal doesn't taste super good. Expensive-ish for just average things.
author: linda t.

description: The server was extremely friendly. The sandwich I had, Pollo pesto (their special) was probably the best sandwich I have had. (And I've been to Ikes, Birite, all those places) I still think about their sandwiches on a weekly, maybe even daily basis... okay maybe not that much. But they are DAMN good. The price is not bad at all when considering how friggin huge they are, and the quality of the ingredients.
author: Jess C.

description: Really enjoyed my Deviled Egg sandwich, and the side salad was huge!
author: Max Z.

description: Disappointment 3 of 3 in the Mission.  Tried the roast beef, turkey with cranberry and vegetarian sandwiches.  The use of mayo on all the sandwiches wasn't desirable, but there also wasn't a whole lot of flavor coming from anything else other than the cranberry.  The meat amount was good with the turkey but sparse with the roast beef.  Overall, would rather eat a sandwich from Pluto's or Ike's every day of the week.
author: Paul K.

description: What a great find!  Fast service and a great menu!  The Nuevo Cubana is fantastic,  super tasting sandwich.  The ABT Sandwich has the most bacon I've ever seen on a sandwich, great sandwich!  Stopped by on the way home twice this week, I'm addicted!
author: Ken B.

description: The food is great but so are the two guys who run this shop. We wandered in on a weekend afternoon - the place was empty and the owners told us how they got into the business, their interest in the space, etc. Very cool. And then they threw in a cookie for free :) Good people, great food.
author: K D.

description: Great sandwich, great salad. Good selection of drinks. Cozy joint with few tables, best to take it out for a picnic. Not as greasy, messy, loaded as icky Ike's, just right and light and fills you up leaving enough room in your tummy to get an ice cream. Go there and you'll not regret it. I gave it four stars 'stead of five since they do not offer enough healthy choices.
author: Pepe W.

description: Great new spot in the area. Check out the Hainan Chicken sandwich!
author: Brian K.

description:
What a good sandwich. I've had pretty much the entire menu to date and have yet to be disappointed. The owners know what they are working with and put together a sammy quickly and for a good price. 

We're NOT talking $13 over-priced sandwich people, this stuff is a good deal at a great price and if you are lucky you'll get to meet the owners in their small shop. Feel free to ask them about sandwiches or general life advice including but not limited to southeast Asia, love and relationships. 

Top notch sammy, good ingredients and a good price. What more could you want?
author: Andrew L.

description: Overall I really enjoyed my experience here.  I ordered the Hainan Chicken sandwich which was garlic-y and flavorful.  The bread was the perfect consistency and the ingredients were all harmonious.  As a bonus, I was given a watermelon juice with my sandwich.  I've never been a juice fan before, but this watermelon concoction was awesome!  It was not too sweet, which is why I normally don't like juice.  I would definitely order both again.
author: Elisa H.

description: Cute cozy sandwich and salad spot in the Mission. Ordered the Cranturkey (premium slow roasted turkey, aged Swiss, organic sprouts, light onion, double green leaf, mayo, cranberry sauce on rustic French) - was super delish! Just the right amount of turkey, the sauce was sweet and tasty, and the bread had that perfect amount of crunch! Also recommend their cookies that are freshly baked daily. They have a whole wall of different sandwich selections that all sound delicious, need to come back and try more! Kinda curious about The King (peanut butter, banana, honey, chocolate, frosted flakes, on a crispy brioche).
author: Audrey E.

description: If you haven't been you don't know what you're missing. Seriously. Their staff is super cool and welcoming, which I adore walking into any business. I had the Cuban, which was to die for. I secretly wanted the KING also, but was so stuffed I couldn't imagine having another sandwich in hand, I bet those bananas go hard though. I was told they alternate their sandwiches out so they constantly have new ones to share, which is a plus because trust me every single one (except for the curry because I'm not a fan of curry anytime) makes me extremely indecisive and confused in the best way possible. I am salivating as I'm remembering the warm, toasted, deliciousness pleasuring my tastebuds with every bite. The only thing this place needs is brewskies! I give the picnic an A!
author: Danielle L.

description: Great new addition to the neighborhood.  Had the Hainan Chicken sandwich - loved it.  Garlicky, fresh, lots of tender chicken.  The folks behind the counter are great.  Say hi to Spencer (aka Babyface.)
author: Alice W.

description: I'm in love. These are truly great sandwiches and a steal at the price. Every one I have tried has been exceptional. The salads are bountiful, simple, and flavorful. The $3 delivery fee - delivery via TCB - is worth every penny. My food usually arrives in half the time the confirmation email promises (and no hipster lines to wait in!). The Salumi Special sammy is like an upscale muffaletta, which I have been craving. I Can't believe it took me so long to discover this place.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Had the Hainan Chicken Sandwich and San Franciscan.  Both were fantastic!  The Hainan got perfectly baked dutch crunch, you know with the thin and crunchy outside, and the warm soft inside.  Once your teeth get through the bread, then you get some excellently seasoned chicken the rest of the way through.

The San Franciscan is on a French roll, also with a good crust and warm soft inside the bread.  The pastrami is juicy.  You already think it's amazing, and then the provolone and turkey run through and straight wrestle your taste buds into submission.  Another excellent sandwich.  I've got several more to try like the Cubano and the King.
author: Yoway B.

description: Excellent food!  One of my favorite sanwich places in the city.
author: Ed Z.

description: First impression: Rhea's (19th & Valencia) is way better. Ordered a Hainan (garlic) Chicken sandwich and found it lacking flavor and overly bready. Cost: $9.73.
author: Karl N.

description: I've tried most of the sandwiches here and they're all great. Rivals Hot Press for best sandwiches in the area.
author: Travis N.

description: Great place for a quick sandwich in the mission. I had the premium vegan sandwich and the side baby arugula salad. Fresh, tasty and healthy! The people behind the counter were very friendly too!
author: Abhi V.

description: real good spot for sandwiches. all the ones i have tried have been great but i especially like the Cranturkey (Turkey & Cranberry) sandwich. their bread is always fresh. good spot to get sandwiches from before heading to Dolores Park.
author: Farbod F.

description: Incredible bread spoons with fantastic sandwich fixins at this great lunch nook.
author: Natalie A.

description: Mission Picnic , very catchy name and finally got to try it , the love for sandwiches never stops and having something new and simple other that those big hoagies with cheap deli meats on bread thats injected with steroids is always a plus and much appreciated , the sammy was well constructed  and the bread is the best part . but one star off because the Hainan chicken lacked flavor or maybe did not have enough sauces , i always believe a good sauce can make a sandwich 10 times better . we also tried the deviled eggs on brioche it was very good, looking forward to explore more menu items ...
author: NAEL K.

description: I just stopped in the other day for the first time. I had the chicken salad sandwich- best sandwich I've had in awhile. The cashier (owner?) was very personable- making jokes as he rung me up. The wait was no more than 5 minutes as well. I can't wait to try more including the veggie. There is also a vegan sando available.
author: Amy M.

description:
It's tasty, yes, undeniably tasty. But it takes 20 minutes or more to get 2 sandwiches here and I find it to be very expensive. I mean, I have to be real, I am a sucker for Mr. Pickles, and with that only a few blocks away I am always going to go for Mr. Pickles because they are faster and more reasonably priced and, most importantly, TASTIER! 

I wanted to love this place, I have tried several times, but the witty sandwich names and creative concepts just don't make it worth the price or the wait. Mr. Pickles remains the best sandwich spot in the MIssion, as far I am concerned.
author: c m.

description: The hot cuban sandwich is to die for.  Just delicious.  The assortment of sandwichs are great for eating there or taking to go.
author: David G.

description:
I happened upon this place while wandering through the Mission - I'm always on the lookout for a good sandwich. All I can say I WOW if you're a sandwich person you must try this place!! I got the Picnic Club and it was the perfect balance of moist yet crunchy bread, chicken salad, and all the rest of the fixings. The sandwiches are huge, so if you don't have a large appetite you could easily share one. 

If I'm back in San Francisco I'm going to make it a point to come back and try The King - banana, honey, chocolate, peanut butter, and frosted flakes - oh my!
author: W. T.

description: Great food but always pay cash with delivery (the tip at least). The delivery service folks are city bike thugs and completely unbearable. The most recent order was by a guy that wouldn't ring the doorbell and when I did make my way to the building door, he was on the phone, stuck out his arm with the bag while he continued to talk on the phone.  The raised arm and bag was the only acknowledgment this guy made. These kind of folks make this city much less than it could be. Hopefully they'll find another delivery service since the food is good.
author: Bob C.

description: The Nuevo Cuban was unreal... Mission Picnic just became my go-to sandwich place in the city.
author: Kyle S.

description: I eat a sandwich here at least 3x per week...the san franciscan is too good. Staff is super friendly and owner is very attentive and friendly. Great service - thank you MP!
author: Misao T.

description: I have finally found the restaurant that upset me enough to get a yelp account.  Thank you, Mission Picnic for popping my yelp review writing cherry.  That's about all I can thank you for.  The food here isn't even all that bad.  It is pretty standard.  But the customer service I received today (or didn't receive) left me beyond perplexed.  I ordered lunch for my office through GrubHub (love them - they are always good to me) and got a call from the restaurant that the food was on its way, but they had forgotten a sandwich.  She presented me with the option of a refund, but that would have completely defeated the purpose as to why I ordered food to be delivered.  Our crew is filming in the studio today and no one can leave the office.  She said because they were already on the way, they would rather refund.  I told her then one person would be out a lunch and asked them to please correct their mistake and send the sandwich.  When the first order came I realized there was a second sandwich missing (for the founder and CEO of my company, nonetheless.)  I tried calling several times but got no answer.  I finally called GrubHub, who after several times of trying to contact them as well told me they were refusing to send the SECOND missing sandwich because they were too busy.  I will NEVER order food from here again.  You forget two people's lunch and REFUSE to send it because you're too busy?  Not my fault as a paying customer that your staff can't get it together.  So as far as customer service here, the service part of that simply doesn't exist.  "Refusing re-delivery because its too busy......" Unbelievable.
author: Chelsea S.

description:
Fantastic sandwiches from this new hole-in-the wall sandwich purveyor. I've been there three times since they opened and I'm stuck on the  San Franciscan (Hot pastrami, turkey & provolone) but one of these days I'm going to branch out and try the cultish Hainan Chicken (Garlic rotisserie chicken, cukes and picnic spread).  
My partner tried the King, a PB, bananas, honey, dark chocolate & frosted flakes sandwich that's like having dessert first.  
Good quality and tasty creations. 
I'LL BE BACK!!!
author: Ann P.

description: From the reviews, I assume the meat options are far better than the vegetarian options. We stopped by and had the Pesto-Mozzarella sandwich and the Premium Vegan. The latter was such a bummer. The sandwich was incredibly dry -- just a little hummus -- and there was no salt, no pepper, no seasoning whatsoever. The Pesto-Mozzarella at least had some flavor, but zero points for innovation. These are sandwiches you can find on any menu, and that can be prepared far better at home for a fraction of the price. Major disappointment -- nothing distinctive, and no reason to return.
author: Scott B.

description: Chicken Pesto- One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time.  I loved the arugula and goat cheese in it. The chicken mixture was delicious. The filling to bread ratio was perfect. I hate it when is there too much bread or too much meat. All the ingredients were fresh and good quality. I highly recommend this sandwich. Sooo good! = )
author: Pam G.

description: i heard this is a good place to get a sandwich for a picnic in the park. i live on the other side of the park so i've never been but today i walked by and stopped in. i had the nuevo cubano. i'm generally not much of a meat person but it looked interesting. fire roasted pork, black forest ham, pepper jack, red onion, avocado jalepeno aioli dijon and PINEAPPLE yum i love sweet with savory and a bit of spicy! all that for, i think, about $8. They charge you an extra sixty or thirty cents if you use a credit card under ten dollars. this is a sandwich to fill you up! They also have fresh juice and fruit like watermelon. there are some other sandwiches that look good, like the cranberry turkey one. i wish i could eat peanuts, because they have one with peanutbutter, chocolate, bananas and CORN FLAKES! ill most likely be back! oh, and there's about three tables, this is more of a takeout place than an eat in. hence the name Picnic.
author: Merredith L.

description: Mmmmm ... Hainan chicken sandwich!  Damn it was good! Nice toasty rustic bread roll with generous amounts of chicken , garlic spread, aand lettuce with a thai chili pepper on the side. I've never had a sandwich like it and the chili pepper had a nice little kick to it that went really well with it. Staff was nice, friendly, and knowledgeable about what ingredients they used and where it came from. Admittedly this was the only sandwich I've had here, but I'll be back to try the others.
author: Cliff L.

description: I order some food n got the email to pick it up 10-30 min later, only to receive phone calls n texts saying different things. One saying they were closed, another saying it was gonna b 30 min late. Long story short, I didn't get my food, n not sure about my money either. Girl on the phone wanted me to call eat24 to get my money back even though it was their mistake.
author: Paul G.

description:
the sandwiches are good.
the Francisican being the top Notch.

the 1 star is soley on the amount of time one has to wait 
when you order in advance on their website.
I ordered the sandwich on line 12:45pm, mind you it does state
10-30 min reay time , (but for a sandwich) come on!
walked in 1pm, told me 5 more min. as I watched people who
ordered on site come & go.
1:15pm Sandwich ready.
10min at most walk in. 25-30 order on line.

do yourself & your patience a favor....
WALK IN !

Fyi Filet Mignon takes 17 min to cook medium well... just saying
author: peter g.

description: Really great sandwiches! Had the "southerner"(of course) which was great. It had fire roasted pork, bacon, AND an amazing pimento cheese spread! The staff was especially friendly. Space is small, but overall five stars.
author: C C.

description: Love Mission Picnic! Their food and people are awesome! Sterling does a great job with the staff and customers that keep me coming for any last minute meals. This place is a must eat!
author: Jeanelle L.

description: Very very tasty I normally don't go in for sandwiches with long ingredients lists but this was an excellent time for me to deviate from my normal path!  Excellent addition to the neighborhood.
author: Regina O.

description: Mission Picnic is just what the neighborhood needs. Try the sgt. Slaughter sandwich. It's awesome. Mission picnic provides fast, delicious sandwiches without the frills or nonsenses of some others deli style shops in the area. I dig it and am headed back today for another crack at their menu
author: Connor D.

description: I used to work near here, and every time I went to Mission picnic there was a bit of a wait. There's pretty much never going to be a chair available, so plan on taking it to go. The sandwiches really are good, but honestly this place gets more from it's trendy status than I think it really deserves. Worth a try, but I didn't make it a regular thing.
author: Nik K.

description: Great new lunch place - has an interesting selection of specialty sandwiches ranging from meat to cutting edge to healthy.  Nice combination of portion size, excellent ingredients and freshly made with care at a reasonable price.  Perfect for takeout as well.
author: J B.

description: Good sandwiches! I like the San Franciscan it was so juicy!!!!! I usually order from this place since I just live 30 steps away! one thing I recommend is call ahead of time because they do take 15 min to make your sandwich. I remember i called in one day and came in 15min and it was not ready since they had a huge catering order, so I waited another 10 patiently and then another 10min frustrated!! Everyone in that store was also with a straight face because they been waiting for a long time. Overall it took 35 min to get my sandwich, and I was late for my final and that is why I am giving them a 3 star. Every single time I think of this place I think twice because of that one experience I had. It does suck to not have an accurate estimation!!! Because i recently got San Francisco Jun16th and my sandwich was cold because I decided to go in 15min instead of 10 min.  But overall if you have time to wait and you want a good sandwich come here!
author: THe real TrUth D.

description: Came by with a hankering at 4:30 and said they closed over a half hour early because they were understaffed. Not a way to run a business. Just going back to hit up reliable Ike's.
author: Greg S.

description: this place just opened and its soooooooooo EFFING good! i had the hainan chicken and died.
author: Courtney H.

description: tried out this new sandwich spot this weekend and loved it! great sandwiches - not a lot of room to sit down, but super close to Dolores Park
author: Lizzie S.

description: Best sandwiches in the Mission!  I got the Hainan Chicken and the chicken was moist and flavorful, bread was crispy but not so hard that it cuts the roof of your mouth.  Perfect place to stop by for goodies on the way to the park.  Highly recommend!
author: Virginia C.

description: Delicious! The Cuban was amazing. Friendly service.
author: Stephen D.

description: San Franciscan was amazing!! They cut up the meat so the each bite is neat. The flavor reminds me of my days back with Jimmy Johns but I love this place. It's so unassuming but so worth the time. it's a small place with three or four tables. Its really a pick up and go hence the word picnic.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: solid bread quality (my sandwich barometer), quick and friendly service, not too busy at noon. really loved the perfectly sweetened watermelon juice.
author: Dee R.

description: Huge fan of these sandwiches!  If you're in the area, definitely a place to drop by.  It's a small space but love the detail and the story of the place.  I decided to give their albacurry sandwich a try and was a fan.  Can't wait to head back soon to try more of their creative concoctions.  Keep up the good work, MP!
author: Alice Y.

description: Considering the 200 other places to eat in the Mission, I will not come back here.  Service was friendly, and I don't mind waiting, but paying $9-$10 for a sandwich that consists of avocado, bland hummus, and those really bad, cheap, light pink tomatoes...the kind they use at Subway, was pretty disappointing.  The focaccia was over toasted too.  My friends mozzarella sandwich was also just ok.  This place would be 3-4 stars better if they used better quality, locally farmed ingredients and seasoned their food properly.  Just not worth $9.
author: amanda g.

description: Great sandwiches. Nice people. I wish they would switch the menu up a bit more, but other than that, pretty darn good. I recommend the egg salad.
author: Sam W.

description: Wow!  My premium vegan sandwich was so good, I got the chills!  Everything super fresh and the focaccia was perfectly toasted.
author: John V.
